k3S_tR5eSbHvte_HvxCD2A.text: This place is great! I had one of the best hamburgers I have ever had! Thick, charcoal grilled, very good! The prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was nice.

G1ED8JXXt3ejj6ZW54q8vw.text: While visiting a friend last week in Charlotte we decided to get a drink and some food at Whiskey Warehouse!  I would call it a mid to high end sports bar/restaurant.  It has a really great rooftop bar that has heat lamps, umbrellas and a ton of huge screens for watching any popular sports game (some might like that more than me).    The bartenders were very nice and super efficient.  The food on the other hand took forever!  They did warn us that it would take 30 minutes for food but it took closer to an hour.  It was fine, just gave us more time to drink booze but I don't know if I would go back to eat, maybe just get a drink.  Great view of downtown too!

OyA_r--OjQ2kPOkxearMUw.text: I came in this afternoon to watch the Panthers game with some friends. A lot of people have told me that Whiskey Warehouse has some of the best wings in the city so I thought I'd give them a try. I tried the hot wings, and I thought they were way too mild and lacking in flavor. Personally, I prefer the wings at Moosehead or Lebowskis, but whatever, they were OK i guess.  Aside from the food being pretty forgettable, though, the service that we received was very good. Our server's name was Megan, and she was very friendly and attentive throughout the whole experience. She checked in regularly to make sure we had all the food and drinks we needed throughout the game.  Overall, I thought Whiskey Warehouse had a nice atmosphere for watching football on Sundays, with plenty of TVs and a good selection of beers on tap, so I would gladly come back to drink and watch sports here. That being said, with all the other excellent food options elsewhere in Plaza Midwood, I may get food somewhere else beforehand next time.

DXxhtzP2ayufAmDsliXeuw.text: Love the rooftop bar. Went inside to eat, took almost an hour to get food and the salmon and fries were cold. Something isn't right here, potential, but need some intervention. Won't be back and won't recommend.

z2UTQc2SrE63iH6291egPA.text: Two things I absolutely love in this world: whiskey and rooftop patios. Clearly, I was destined to end up at Whiskey Warehouse at some point during my Charlotte visit.   The rooftop has a great environment and view, service isn't bad, and the drinks are abundant, especially those pitchers! Any of them with whiskey were my favorites, but I probably don't need to tell you that twice. Great to share with a few friends and really just enjoying a beautiful spring night in Charlotte.   As with most rooftop patios, it got packed really quickly here (and probably does on most nights) so be ready to wait for a table to open up.

mtXaXAjXPQDxivx17uijmw.text: Good ole Whiskey Warehouse. First time I came here was 3 years ago when I got home from Iraq. I had not been to plaza mid-wood in years. Not a bad spot for catching up with old friends. They do have some good food as well. My favorite was walking in there on a Sunday picking up to go food for a sick friend. Food was not ready and I had to wait. They had a lovely Bloody Mary bar set up to which I helped myself to while I waited. Pretty clever I will say. They also have music on the weekends and for a bar, they get a thumbs up from me.

hAJUe29YD-hPY9riRU7w6A.text: Well, after 10 minutes of waiting at the bar for the bartender to acknowledge my existence, I decided to leave.  She was talking to one guy the whole time, there were 5-6 people sitting at the bar---she wasn't swamped.

gfBfEvAUUH90H3_hW6E1Rw.text: Came here for dinner on a weeknight with a friend. We sat on the rooftop area which was amazing because it had a fantastic view. I wouldn't recommend sitting up here though if you are bothered by a light of people standing around drinking and smoking. If you are looking for more relaxed dinner vibes eat inside. Some weeknights I am sure wouldn't be bad but weekends especially it is mostly for the drinking crowd.  I had the spicy vegetable stir fry and it was good. I am a huge spice fan so I can handle a lot and I felt this was spicy in a way I enjoyed but something others would find overly spicy. Will def. have to come again.

eK3MwtQs5dpwpMDxezjQoQ.text: Usually I love Whiskey Warehouse but recently the food hasn't been the greatest. Ordered something and was told it'd be about 15 minutes. Waited at the bar almost 30 minutes to get my food. I got all the way home when I realized it was completely messed up.... when it's all I've wanted all day long. Not worth the time to go back, especially when it's so late and I'm exhausted from working all day. Prepare for subpar service if you go here.

274WESyfItL9MCNs0-75Mw.text: Thought I already reviewed this place but maybe not?  Oh well, it's not the first place I think of when I want to hang out in Midwood.  The service and food is par and the beer selection is sub par compared to other bars in the area.  The patio on the roof is the real benefit.  If the weather is right, there's not many better patios or rooftop locations in Charlotte to go to.  My suggestion is to try it for yourself.  The interior decor is actually pretty cozy with warm wood materials, etc.  Parking can be tough as it is with any business in Plaza Midwood so be ware.

oUU61emcqDw0YQ2b9YLCAg.text: Absolutely fabulous service at Whisky Warehouse! GABBY is an amazing server and incredibly friendly. Make sure you ask for her!!

DDzhKNu2shCr8nRpwKoB3g.text: I have a mixed opinion on this place.  I have ate here three times, with one YUM experience, one "That was pretty good" and one "eeeehhhhh" that was ok experience.  The salmon salad is DELICIOUS!  I would highly recommend it for a healthy option.  I also saw a few friends get it.  The only thing I will say is that the actual salmon portion has looked a little inconsistent.  I got the Buffalo Chicken wrap with grilled chicken instead of fried.  It was pretty good, nothing special.    My ehhhhhh dish was the Prime Rib sandwich.  I was really excited to try it, especially after my server spoke so highly of it, but I was disspointed.  I think the worst part was the bun it was served on.  It was what I'd consider a "sandwich bun" you would get at a cafeteria, with weird seed things on it.  Good drink specials....Bud Light for $2 and Bloody Mary bar with a million sauces and mixes for $3.  The upstairs patio is awesome!  Though doesn't compete with the new member of the neighborhood's Peculiar Rabbit.

kp84eF11qkCaKMBfOw1Xcg.text: Love coming to this place to watch a game, and usually they have some pretty great drink specials. Super disappointed in the food lately. It used to be great, but then they changed the menu and everything seems cheap, poor presentation and they skimp on ingredients. Usually get the nachos and was extremely disappointed. Over 1/2 the chips had nothing on them. It was basically a a few pieces of chicken, tomatoes and some cheese. No salsa. No sour cream. No beans. And for $11! Could've gotten better nachos at Taco Bell for $1. Not sure I will be ordering food here anymore.

4wZONMD5bDR2UCOEXJsfeA.text: Food sucks even for bar food wings are horrible along with their fried food and stay away from fries and mac n cheese they do have some good specials on whiskey only good thing about this place.

BZ7TM496JdmjQkp3LfWXMg.text: THIS PLACE SERVES FOOD!!!!!  My group came here for main intention witch is whiskey.  And Whiskey we had....and had.....and had.   I love the selection of whiskeys.  They have Makers 47!  The bartenders were awesome and so easy when they have the same name

foT-4JOeC-BimInWBKcXqg.text: Amazing experience from start to finish. We called to see if kids were okay to bring, and they were super friendly over the phone (& definitely kid friendly). Upon getting there we had a brief wait, but were greeted and updated by their friendly staff. The food was great, the service was great, and the atmosphere was fun! We will definitely be back for more (although because of the kids we mostly order in their wings and pretzels ) Can't wait to check it out on the roof top! Oh, and did I mention how friendly everyone is?!?

vLFk0mt8TsjEAlRARgNllw.text: Love this place. The atmosphere is freaking fabulous. And I am always surprisingly happy with the food. I didn't expect them to have such good food but they really do! Big portions, good salads, awesome apps. I love that they have $4 Jack every day I mean come on, just for that I'd go. The view is great. The staff is always great. We just love it! Maybe some more fans though it gets hot as hell up there!

AdeMRSXJ-o8Ia3W4ckbe0g.text: i've been to this place a few times.  This place is always packed with people but i don't mind.  The thing that we usually get here are their pitchers.  If you come here with a group of friends, the pitcher is what i suggest you should get.  Its a great way to not spend a lot of money and still get your drank game on! The pitchers are relative cheap for the amount of alcohol content you get  This place is a great starter place to come to pregame and bar hop to the next place. The environment is real chill and they serve some pretty good food that compliments the drinks here  I recommend getting the Jack and Coke pitcher as that is their most popular one.  Also the lemon drop one is pretty tasty too.

QAtoriI2g4pJXDVDOZ7xow.text: The hubs and I came here for a late lunch on Sunday.  We had meant to arrive earlier, but our neighbor Hippie Mike paid us an unexpected visit.  For hours.  Nevertheless, it was a beautiful partly cloudy day with non wilting temperatures, so we headed for the rooftop.   To our delight, they were playing blues music.  But, soon after our arrival, it switched to the worst rock of the 90's/turn of the century, except for one song by Velvet Revolver. Our drink orders were promptly taken, and we settled in to enjoy the magnificent view.  Everyone in Charlotte needs to come to this rooftop at least once. My husband ordered the talapia sandwich, which he said was ok.  It was fried, and he would have preferred it baked.  But my meal?  Holy herbivore!  I got the fried green tomato sandwich (and yes, I welcomed fried with open arms.). The bun had a smear of pimento cheese on it, too.  Yum!  Our orders came with fries, which was fine by me. I have to say it was well worth listening to Hippie Mike's monologue  of righteous opinions to have this late lunch as my reward.

xosVd3JJ1I9XzThNDI40NA.text: Food was delicious but my server on the rooftop was beyond awful this past Thursday. I won't be back.

zwwzCfMSPnzsiic6a067dg.text: 10 wings for 16 dollars; they better be the size of my arm. (Disclosure: they aren't)

nP7PUJa5BhR2PZI4LLBKdw.text: Drinks good, rooftop good, food is bad and the service even worse.  Drastic change in this place from 3-4 years ago.

h_vfhUVOUfnjPW7sQUh7yw.text: Whiskey Warehouse is THE place to be on Thursday nights, if you're looking for a relaxing evening after work. Wine is offered as a special at half the price (sangria excluded!) I love to sit downstairs at the bar and chat it up with Margeoux (could be spelling it wrong) SHE'S AWSOME!  She makes the best sangria hands down! GO SEE HER. The food is always on point and the service matches. I highly recommend this place!

DaZByd-yEKpz6cm6KWPeGw.text: Classic bar food with plenty of tvs for watching.   We stopped in on a Saturday evening. There was no wait and our food came out quickly. My companions both had the house burger that they were satisfied with. I had the deep fried pimento cheese balls that were listed as homemade, but anytime something comes out in a uniform perfect shape all the way across that statement loses a little bit of credibility. I am talking perfect circle here. That didn't stop me from enjoying them though, they were basically pimento mozzarella sticks and they were great.   Our waitress was very nice, and everything was reasonably priced. If I were looking for a quick bite to eat in the area or trying to catch a game on I would definitely check it out again.  Update went back with family this weekend and the burger was MASSIVE and delicious!

6kIQcrN_N3iLQg5r-cIigw.text: ABSOLUTELY WORST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE EVER! Literally. Look at my reviews for other places. The service was terrible. Food too. The server refused to honor the happy hour pricing when I asked for an item to be replaced. That definitely sealed her fate with the tip I left. Additionally, she was nowhere to be found most of my visit. Definitely won't be back. I love when I visit somewhere for dinner for the first time and they leave me with lasting impressions.

NgmZIYVcP0KT_-kcJL03BQ.text: Neat atmosphere like an old whiskey saloon inside.  But the best part is the rooftop bar/eatery with a great city backdrop.  Food was slower than I prefer but to be expected anytime I dine outside.  I ordered the buffalo wrap which was great but the fries were cold.  They gladly accommodated me with new.  Overall I'd be back to eat on the rooftop with a city view.  Price point was affordable as well

UGSdU7gLeNc0PBtDOWOSbQ.text: They have pretty good bar food, if you can find even one member of their staff that cares about getting it to you. I've given this place like 5 tries. I'm done.  Let me break down your average visit to Whiskey Warehouse. Step 1 - Walk in and wait 5-10 minutes for a server or host to greet you.   Step 2 - Wait at your table another 10-15 minutes for your server.  Step 3 - After your server is done updating their Instagram at the server station she will come up to you shocked and appalled that you're the type of horrible human being that would dare order food at a restaurant. How dare you. HOW DARE YOU! She can't even.  Step 4 - Your order is sent to the kitchen and I can only assume the ticket is printed in some type of  ancient language that the staff has to take several hours to break down and translate.  Step 5 - Explain to your friends and family why they haven't seen you in months. Why you've missed holidays, work, birthdays.  Spoiler: It's because you're STILL waiting on your food.  Step 6 - Get your really solid bar food. Mostly super basic fried food and burgers. It is good tho.  Step 7 - Hope to god you have cash to leave on the table because I can't imagine having to wait to get your check back.  Step 8 - Step outside and cherish the fact that you've seen daylight once more.  A couple of sides to this. Only order something from the bar if you're some kind of weird person that loves punishment. Like the only way you can enjoy that beer is by suffering impossibly for it first.  I once ordered a to go pretzel to go. The person that took my order said 10-15 minutes. I literally laughed after we hung up. I being the expert planner that I am showed up in 25 minutes, fully expecting to wait another 5-10 minutes. After 45 minutes ... I got my pretzel.  The management is super nice and very apologetic, but at some point sorry isn't good enough and you need to fix your mistakes.  If the place was one street over it would have closed down 1 week in. Their location and the fact that a place called "Whiskey Warehouse" will bring in every frat bro within 50 miles is the only reason they stay afloat.

K30gNwMRAwR-Wvu4XYnVmw.text: Is this the best patio in Charlotte? Quite possibly.   A rooftop bar with a tremendous view of the city. Pair that with great food and the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Money.   I've had a little bit of everything from the menu. No complaints. All good. Love the wings. There are daily lunch specials. Thursday is prime rib night. $13/$15 is a great deal. Half off apps Monday-Friday from 4-6pm.  Tons of beers. A good selection of local suds. Great drink specials throughout the week. On Sundays, $2 mimosas and $3 for the bloody mary bar.   Parking is the one issue here, but that's everywhere in Plaza Midwood.   Back to the patio... It's no secret. Want to do happy hour? Get there early.   Lunch, dinner, date night, drinks with friends, Sunday fun day. This place is perfect for it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomato &#34;burger&#34;
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken dip
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese dip

IXt1yzBfkl7OdnUJM4xYfw.text: Showed up at 1pm on a Sunday.  Was pretty crowded but the wife and I were the only ones in line so the wait was only ~10 minutes.  Good to go.  I ordered a lunch dish (salmon sandwich). Wife ordered an omelette (vegetarian).  Food took 50 minutes to arrive.  Mine was OK.  Wife's order was f'd up but we were starving after waiting so long, so we let it slide.  Both meals were OK at best.  Will give a second chance at some point, but with so many good choices in the area that can seat and serve in under an hour, I have a half a dozen other places to go that have better than "OK" food.  I need to be fair here.  The wait was not unusual as far as I could tell; all those around us that were seated in a similar timeframe took just as long to receive food.  So this place just runs slow.  This is most likely a function of how the kitchen is smaller than the galley in my apartment, despite probably serving ~150 guests at a time.  Best part is food is comparatively cheap vs most brunch spots.  Bottom line: Whiskey FailHouse

sZ9hGgdyQkda4CPYHv5KkA.text: Great atmosphere but food and beer are pricey for what you get. Great for game watching since they have a ton of TVs. Tables are really close together which makes it hard to navigate the restaurant.

LWOte28k9PV9yxn1D7kp4A.text: Love this place. Ask for Martha behind the bar! Sometimes they're a little slow on sundays for brunch especially upstairs, but they managers are very accommodating for any troubles. One of the best views of the city! Perfect summer hangout spot! $4 jack specials are always a reason to come back! This place is a second home!

FO0H-88JtK5K4x3kpy7F9g.text: They were already low on my list. Now they don't even have boneless wings on their half off options for Monday nights. So basically it's adios - I will not be returning. There is literally nothing here for me anymore.

nDeCsNED0-k_6yaqbsd5EQ.text: Visited twice and both times excellent food and generous pours on the drinks! Service is pretty good for as busy as they were on both visits.   Definitely sit on rooftop. Get a nice view of Charlotte skyline!   Bathrooms could be a little cleaner.  Overall fun place with great food.

jhhEQ_vH82-3FHNpO07CxQ.text: Love whiskey warehouse!! I'm upset they don't do their wing special on Mondays anymore and even more upset when a place that's known for whiskey runs out of whiskey!!! This has happened twice already.

LCWl0NHlUvc235APxLk7wQ.text: Stopped in here randomly while exploring Plaza Midwood.  Parking is around back, but fills up quickly.  Good drink selections, menu is simple and concise, and the Chicken Pasta was absolutely incredible! Highly recommended!

uznDO5aDeypOorngCWwA2g.text: Whiskey Warehouse is a great place for spring/summer to hang out on the rooftop balcony. It's always busy and with an eclectic group of people, all nice. There are also several televisions to catch whatever sport is on tv. In this case, it was March Madness. You WILL struggle to find a table and pretty much have to stalk one to wait for people to get up or just make friends while they're sitting there. I had the special of the day on my last trip, which were shrimp skewers over rice with spinach and tomatoes. It wasn't anything special, but filling and with enough lemon spice to forego salt and pepper. Whiskey punch is also pretty good. Come for the sun, new friends, and drinks. Parking is terrible in Plaza Midwood in general, so be prepared to deal with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rooftop bar
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rooftop patio
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Friday special - lemon shrimp skewers w/ rice, spinach, and tomatoes.

hxsAgwGm8U9pxZ2n-oVObw.text: The fact that I'm not really into Whiskey sort of explains the three stars. This is a VERY popular place to hangout in Plaza Midwood. My last visit I tried the buffalo shrimp for the first time and they were decent. The salmon sandwich and fried fish sandwich are REALLY good. This is a great place to watch the game.

DtVR8V6j1Rdxf_rcd3FB5w.text: I wanted to try this place for brunch but it let me down. The wait was long and there were open tables just not being cleaned. The food took forever and came out burnt. The wait staff was very rude and did not seem to care about their customers that were dining. Very disappointed in the overall experience at this establishment.

PXQiY21domGkXh0Eig7XHw.text: They have a pretty solid list of whiskey. I really enjoy the idea of whiskey flights too. They usually have good drinks specials too.   If we are going to Plaza Midwood for brunch this is the first place we will go to. They have a lot of options and all for a decent price.  There are tons of tvs and the upper roof deck is awesome when the weather is right. They even will run heaters when it starts getting cooler. It has an awesome view of the skyline and another full bar up top too.   They also show ufc fights and not many places do that around town without charging. I would definitely recommend WW! Just be aware that they do get busy come weekend time so expect a little wait.

FSMbOB3pW2LOxMbevUxMvQ.text: I'm writing this review based off drinks alone.  I didn't order any food but the atmosphere is a lot of fun.  Be sure to go on a sunny day and sit on the roof top patio.  Cool vibes and great for a small group of friends.  It gets pretty crowded on the weekends so get there early (if you're day drinking) or maybe call ahead.  Very cool place and excited to hang out there this summer!

pvNwc8hgqSQSXICbVP1yWQ.text: I went there on a friday night with a couple friends and we had some drinks and dinner. I agree that this place pretty much seems outta place with its location and some of the douche bags it appears to draw. Maybe they will draw a better customers in the future but as long as the crowd they have now is spending, then management is probably perfectly ok with them.   I had the salmon which was delicious and we all shared the nachos app which was pretty spicy but also delicious. I found the beer selection to be moderately priced, maybe leaning a little towards  expensive. I didn't bother with the whiskey menu as that stuff pretty much turns me into a raging asshole. The decor of the place was cozy and it seemed to be laid out fairly well. However, the parking there sucks and we were lucky to get a spot. I'd probably give this place 4 stars but for the time being the frat boy customers look like they've all just graduated from Buckhead Saloon downtown and brought their doucheness to a new venue for display. Go check it out if you've got a chance. I probably wouldn't recommend being a regular though.

BtbwXIIHXI-uZbF7Ds1b_g.text: great rooftop bar with nice views of Charlotte's skyline

ta4PSdB1B1RY3CdDrY8QJw.text: The wings are great, especially on 1/2 off Mondays. The rooftop bar is also great, the 2 flights of stairs help you work off the wings.   Downside-on weekends they have a DJ and the music volume is VERY VERY loud.  This is a bar/restaurant and in trying to make it into a dance club, the Warehouse loses the appeal of lounge for conversing and sipping a fine drink.  We have to yell so loudly that the person in the next seat can hear pieces of a conversation. As a Speech-Language Pathologist, I can state that the combination of alcohol, yelling over loud music, and trying to hear over loud music causes damage to the vocal cords and hearing abilities.

wR12v5jWPdlSIhTOftaAmQ.text: I've been here multiple times for drinks with friends and always had decent service - not good, just ok. Finally tried their wings because I've always heard how great they are, and I was so disappointed! The flavors were fine, but the wings were soggy and flabby. I ate a few of them and didn't even bother to take the rest home.

-Rq2PoXejQNxts3kVdX8Dw.text: Met some friends for a few drinks and some appetizers. After being rushed to order, we were interrupted by a giant cockroach that ran across our table and down the wall. The manager was very understanding and comp'd us our food.  We paid for our drinks, tipped our waitress, and headed to the bar where the manager said we were more than welcome to sit. Once there, we were instructed, completely unprofessionally, by the bartender that people were sitting there still. So we went and sat at a different table. Two minutes later, the hostess told us to leave because there was a short wait.  We were left with drinks in our hand, and no where to go after being grossed out by a big damn bug.  So in short: alright food, bad service, and BUGS. It was an absolutely awful experience.

4RlJYsAb3rNSc3QEMvFcRQ.text: Good food and great service. Waitress was nice and allowed me and my dinner guest to chat and order when we were ready. The beer was good.

OzpUz8_2HHMFPATipbMlGQ.text: I had my doubts about this place from the beginning, but since it was suggested by another person in our fairly large party, I decided not to be difficult and go.   We arrived at 8:30 on a Friday night. The wait was OK considering we had 9 in our group. They do have a cozy waiting section in the corner, filled with plush couches and chairs, however it's not a very intimate spot. The music was so loud and the couches were so far apart everyone in the group ended up shouting across the space just to have a conversation.   The wait staff, hostesses and bartenders we all very friendly and quick to offer up something to drink. The food was ... OK. Not the worst I've had, but certainly not the best. I got the grilled cheese - it was as expected. The fries were very good. Two friends got burgers, who said they were decent, and another two friends got the steak kabobs, which received mediocre reviews.   The other patrons weren't quite as fratty as I was expecting from reading previous reviews on here, but I can see where they were going with it. No Affliction or Ed Hardy tees in sight ...

p-TTU_HNrB40cpfzD0qloQ.text: I really like this place BUT the other reviews are correct. It's hit or miss when it comes to service. I eat here ALOT. A whole lot....but lately the staff keeps changing. The ladies that know us as a regulars treat us fabulous especially Brandy but the rest....not so much. I came in for brunch today. I sat at the bar since I was dining alone. There were 8 people at the bar, max. I sat for several minutes and the bartender never even acknowledged my existence. I really wanted a waffle and realized the patio was open so I went upstairs. Night and day. Ashley greeted me promptly and was attentive. I also notice that lunch service is pretty bad. Last week they had to comp my lunch because the waitress never put my order in. Why do I keep coming back?  Because I really like the food. I normally stick to a salad with salmon or the waffles for brunch plus they have $2 mimosas. Also half price apps from 4-6pm.

_H-Pa6xdQRNP5dVfjKGukg.text: Great environment and food!  Very reasonable prices and rooftop deck is a perfect happy hour spot.

xHLHfypuCBbsKjrmTFN0Wg.text: i first noticed this place existed yesterday when we were on our way to the Penguin and the stupid bus couldn't decide if it was stopping or not at the Thomas Street light so i had to roll up to the next street where Whiskey Warehouse awaited. We decided to come back and give it a try.    We really liked the feel of the place, exposed brick walls, whiskey bottle pub tables, plenty of whiskey decor going on. There were a number of tvs but the sound didn't seem to sync with the tvs i was watching. i'm assuming that is something that will be worked out.    Unfortunately, i have to work today so i couldn't really explore the whiskey or beer options. Waitress said $2 Bud Lights today and $4 Jack everyday i believe.   So we were there for the food. While not a huge menu, there was enough to choose from with most of the standard fare. Of course, i went with the buffalo chicken wrap ($8) minus tomato. It wasn't bad, the sauce didn't seem to be simply on the chicken pieces giving it some buffalo taste even if you were just chewing on the wrap and lettuce which i appreciate. The regular fries weren't bad but the sweet potato fries weren't much better and probably not worth the dollar upgrade. The sweet potato fries don't compare to the ones from the Penguin.   The warehouse chicken received a thumbs up at our table and the Prime rib sandwich was given the "it was ok" rating.   Our server was on top of our drink refills.  i kind of like this place fitting in to the area, sure it isn't too 'eclectic and fun' but it gives a unique watering hole option.

IG5dT5KsbRnLThp5Ysl7VA.text: Great bar in plaza midwood. Very much enjoyed the deck with the view of the city. Went for a late lunch on a Sunday, had decent mimosa specials as many other restaurants nearby. Service for food was a little slow, as there seemed to be one server for every table on the deck. Could have maybe used a little more help but otherwise the food and drinks were delicious.

WHr_91-IRyQ9IuEBk5alwQ.text: I've lived in the area for three years and just recently discovered this place.  I love the rooftop bar and my boyfriend likes the cool mist of water they spray out on customers when it's hot out (don't worry you won't get wet).  I've never had a bad meal or bad service, no matter how busy the place gets. I can't say that about many restaurants in Charlotte.  They do get packed on Friday and Saturday nights but as long as you don't mind fighting for tables or bar space you'll still enjoy.

52ux_yxaUo1oZqynDQxEmA.text: There is a rooftop area and often a crowd, so you should check it out for drinks. The food is OK but nothing special.

rLGgwG0ZhiH5tSM8Rc5ilA.text: Whiskey Warehouse - your service sucks and I could get better pimento cheese dip at the HT across the street.  I was here last Thursday and at 11pm a snottty manager-type lady came over and asked us to cash out because she wanted to leave for the night.  WHAT??  How can you be rude and come over so early?!  I looked at my watch and thought geeez time must have gotten away from us but no - it was only 11.  Are you kidding?  Can yall get with it?

lcdwA9AUoVLyXGvHbTVUuA.text: Bartenders are super nice here, Great roof top views, Good food at a reasonable price, They always ask your name and tell you theirs, They then remember your name throughout your whole visit!  Oh did I mention they have Whiskey, and they pour heavy!  We just moved to Charlotte, we've been here 3 times already, we think it's our new spot for sure!

PAQYBF_vsilhvL8rE-4SNA.text: Food was great - killer burger and excellent ranch dressing on the buffalo chicken wrap.  The fries are pretty awesome too.  Beer prices were just slightly high, but at least they offered a variety of specials.  Clean place and great atmosphere and decor, will definitely return to this place.

sUHvMV7hW0t-KMr_K3d5aw.text: Sit upstairs on the patio during nice weather and enjoy the view and wings!  Ribs are great too.

2AaQucSY-VwHaUK69Tgp8w.text: Fish & Chips was good.  Decent menu selection, decent prices.

rpYsc_yvmSwBSy5JL4BMDw.text: Looking for a cool spot to socialize, eat amazing food, and enjoy a great beverage? Whiskey Warehouse has it all. Yes, it is a bar with bar food, but it's the best bar and food off of Plaza. TV's float the room in the downstairs area with an old pub feel. Im not a whiskey drinking, but they are known for their whiskey liquor selection; Hence the name, "Whiskey Warehouse." On nice days in Charlotte the patio upstairs is open with a full bar and TV's which over looks downtown Charlotte. Love the atmosphere and the food. I don't think I have ever eaten anything bad on their menu. My boyfriend and I always tend to go to Whiskey when we are in that undecided mood because we never know what we want to eat, like any relationship. On Sundays they have a Bloody Mary bar which is awesome! Grab a shot from the bar and mix your own drink! How cool is that? I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun, cool spot!

-FdvLtVzQuWOS84R6Yzl_w.text: Love coming to this place on Mondays for their half off wings. Maybe not the best wings in town but they're pretty dang good. They also have a decent selection of beers on tap and always have have jack Daniels specials. The rooftop bar has a great view of the city and is a fun place to hang out. I would suggest it for a fall game day retreat. Bloody Mary bar is fully stocked on Sundays for brunch!

WCpBVcxl6L4rbibuTzq3NQ.text: I am a big fan of this place.  First I love whiskey, it's one of my favorites.  The atmosphere here is good and so is the service.  The food is what keeps me coming back.  Before moving to the South I didn't know pimento cheese existed and my waistline was thankful.  Currently it is on the top of my list of favorite foods and my expanding waistline has to visit the gym more often to keep up.  All this rambling is to say GET THE SOUTHERN CHICKEN SANDWICH.  It is a dietary nightmare but oh so delicious.  It is a fried chicken breast with pimento cheese and bacon on a gloriously soft bun.  I've had other stuff here too and it's good, but this sandwich is by far my favorite.  Try it, you won't be sorry...unless you're on a diet.

JpcsIk_sQvnE_I2fv_DeWQ.text: I stopped by their space on Saturday evening at the Brewer's Ball  for the Cystic Fibrosis foundation. They brought some sort of ribs as well as  Pimento cheese with corn chips.  Of course, since I don't partake in beef or pork, I passed on the ribs. But, I sampled their pimento cheese with chips.  It was made the way I like it, meaning its really cheesy, you can't really detect the mayo, and it had a slight kick.

VI8Kf93LqEpglXQChqhGwQ.text: I met a few friends out here last night and really enjoyed my evening. The bartenders were quick and friendly. I enjoyed the DJ's music - nice mix of some new and old school. Of course I drank whiskey. Drink prices were reasonable. There was a good mix of different types of people in the crowd. Not as many "frat boys" as others have reviewed.  I did not have any food, but would go back to try it. So my 4 star rating is just for drinks and the evening vibe of the place.   I would go back.

taj4Vdd4m2GSRQWsnDhEWg.text: Excellent wings and an absolutely gorgeous upstairs outdoor patio that has an amazing view of the city.

03mpurOS_dtIHO-ZtBKWRg.text: Came here to watch the Giants game since it wasn't on at home.  Decided to partake in some $2 mimosas and my friends tried the $3 bloody mary's.  We knew we'd be here for a while so we decided to eat smething right away and then again later.  I had the wings in the barbalo sauce, combo of buffalo and bbq.  They were really good, had a bit of a kick but it evened out w/the sweetness of the bbq sauce.  My friends had fried green tomatoes, which I didn't try but have had them and I really like them, and spinach and atrichoke dip, that was really good too.  After a few hours we decided to eat again and we had grilled cheeses all around.  My nephews had them here once and we all kept stealing bites because it was so good!  I got mac and cheese as a side and the others got fries and sweet potato fries.  Grilled cheese was delish but the sides are not their strong point.  Fries are bit soggy and the mac and cheese was okay, but I didn't find myself digging in like I normally would.  I like it here, the beers are decently priced, its a nice bar, and the staff is pretty good.  I was here early so parking wasn't an issue, but I know it can be.  The clientele was very mixed, there were families, couples out for brunch, some elderly people, plenty of rowdy football fans, but nobody off putting.  All in all I like it here and tend to forget about it.  I will def be back!

p30vD8MPlwVGp9ycgGly9Q.text: If you go, get their wings. My favorite are the Barballo (spelling?). Some of my favorite I've had around town. Their salads are pretty good as well. Sweet potato fries hit the spot. Veggies burger is very run of the mill however. Wait staff are always really nice and easy going. Food takes a LONG time to come out of the kitchen.

EmJ5Eohtpohpw7Epv_lllg.text: I read the reviews before hitting up Whiskey Warehouse and wasn't entirely sure what to expect.  On the one hand, a place that purports to specialize in bourbons and whiskeys and conveniently has a vegetarian menu; on the other hand, reports of a sports bar vibe and a fratty clientele.  Hm.  Still, my brother is a big bourbon drinker and wanted to give it a try.  We rolled in around 8:30 on a Saturday night and were able to snatch a booth with a good view of the USC/Florida game.  Our server was perky and did her best to be helpful but admitted she wasn't much of a bourbon drinker.  She was, however, chatty and amply cleavaged, and given the crowd, the noise, and the TVs, seemed to be appropriate for the type of clientele WW apparently wants to service.  (And, yes, it's True - the clientele was decidedly frat-tastic.)  What I really wanted from WW was a dark, more intimate, saloony-style place, perhaps with servers who actually knew what they were serving and with management who cared more about the whiskey than about the game.  Unfortunately, Whiskey Warehouse is just another generic sports bar dressed up as a concept bar.  Meh.

Zsw2uH9wSArAgCTMTvNg4A.text: I'm a tad overdue on my update. Several visits later and Whiskey isn't has horrible as the rep it seems to have accrued. Yes the fratty crowd hasn't changed much, but it's quite an eclectic fratty crowd.   My last visit was for the UFC fight and I got lots of free schwag. Free schwag, whaaa!? Bud light sponsored the event and gave us free hats, key chain can openers, t-shirts, bottle sleeve/glove coozy thingy and free beer! Free beer, whaaa?  The drink specials are decent, $3 for OMB Copper on Saturday nights at a place that looks this new and nice?? That's a steal. Food isn't too shabby either. Good fried green tomatoes, decent wings, decent Mac n Cheese, and the barrel burger is pretty fulfilling and rad. What is the barrel burger you say? Well my friend, it's a tasty meat patty topped with chili and a fried egg of course!  The DJ still plays a lil' too much Kesha and crap though.

I6Yx036vCiN-D46Qkvqmhw.text: WHISKY WAREHOUSE!! Hard to beat!  If you've ever had salmon, I promise that the "Bourbon Butter Salmon Served with rice and vegetables at $13.00 will be the best salmon you've eaten at any price.  If you've never had salmon, once you try this dish, you'll be hooked.  I took a buddy there today and He had the Salmon on a mixed green salad.  His reaction was "this is way too delicious to be healthy".  No lie, I've had this dish on at least 10 different ocassions.  It gets better every time.   Oh! almost forgot, the Mack & Cheese (what??) and the Chicken Fingers that I got for my daughter are apt for a kid any size.  It was really "yumi" to quote her.  But mommy ate half.   Don't forget to give props to SAM the chef on the way out.

LqYvxfZRerVpUbcPMB528g.text: Decent spot to get drink. Draft beers and Jack Daniels

NEzR912YAElH71kMEe-k4g.text: Really enjoy this place for football. The TVs and sound system are fantastic and there isn't a bad seat in the house. The food is great and reasonably priced too. I really enjoy the wing flavors i tried, but they could be a little spicier and saucier for me, but thats just how i like my wangz, y'allI. I tried the buffalo and the habanero mango flavors, both were delicious. Service is fantastic and the servers are very easy on the eyes. I love tights and yoga pants!

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yup, fried jalapenos

gBg6mhMBc4OxqMm5cslcKA.text: Came here with Friends for Drinks and Food. The Wings were decent. Defiantly more of a causal environment and laid back feel.

5NwqFmCbwfkn72N6wAPfHQ.text: Awful service! Don't try to get a table over 5 people. They won't seat you at over half their tables because the chair will be in the way. Yet you can have a party of 10 stand around a small table. We waited an hour and still wasn't seated. When I spoke with the manager, he was extremely rude! Don't eat here! So many other restaurants in the Mid Wood area would be grateful for your business. Go anyway but here!

C3h4V3pI3SkYi97nmLmiAg.text: Great food. Drink specials are pretty solid. The service is very hit or miss. Sometimes it's great, but more often than not, when we order food from upstairs its cold by the time we get it. And sometimes the service is slow.

QtuMRzOcFzvhYeO2ydod2g.text: I expected to walk into this place and be surrounded with girls dancing on the bar ala Coyote Ugly (sad that's what I think of when I think whiskey bar!), but was pleasantly surprised all around.  We came for a baseball game, Tuesday night around 730. There were some open tables, but we opted for the bar. Asian female bartender was great, and the beers were fresh and clean off the tap and some nights they've got great specials on domestic beers and Monday they've got a deal on ribs.  Anyway, we ordered the Protein Platter (new on the menu) and the Salmon sandwich. Protein Platter was EXCELLENT, and the salmon sandwich was cooked well but I felt like the spicy aoli lacked spice and taste.  Staff was attentive, cheerful and accurate. Food was great, but I felt the salmon was a little blah. Sure it's not your average Plaza Midwood haunt with the mix of punks, bankers and bums BUT it's really a comfy, nice bar that I'll definitely head back to.

nBvQ2t60Rpj4Cs37U9-5iw.text: With the name Whiskey Warehouse, I wasn't sure what to expect. But who cares b/c I loved it! The inside is a huge area full of tables along with a little lounge area with cushy seats and ottomans plus tv's everywhere you look. The service was great plus you can't beat beers for $2 and $3 along with a selection of pretty much every whiskey or scotch under the sun. They have a dj playing current tunes along with the early 90's jams that we all love so. Oddly enough, it seemed louder outside than inside but oh well, it was a great time.  Parking is a bit scarce in their lot but you can always look at the lots off Thomas Street and off street parking or keep an eye out for the cabs strolling by there every five minutes---lifesavers I tell you.  I will be back here for sure.

pDcyFs2oqj12Zmy2eg6biA.text: A warehouse full of whiskey -sure, sounds like fun. A few of us dropped by Whiskey Warehouse after a late dinner down the street.   We arrived around 9:30 pm on a Friday night and, while it wasn't super crowded it was starting to fill up. The music was definitely loud and they were playing all sorts of tunes, mostly rap & pop when I was there. I agree with Julia S. - the crowd was pretty frat like - but frat brothers 10 years post-college.   We were able to order drinks right away and the bartender was fairly friendly and efficient. Just as their namesake states, they have an extensive whiskey menu, and I would hope the servers are helpful in those selections, but none of us partook in those libations. They also had a decent wine selection, too. Inside, WW sports a number of big flats screens and a partial brick/industrial feel inside.   I imagine if you can score a table, this would be a good spot to hang with some friends for a few hours. They also offered some fairly sweet daily drink specials - one that caught my eye is their Sunday drink special - $2 mimosas and $3 Bloody Marys. Mmmmm hmmm...can't wait until noon on Sunday!

MG3m0hlN7fWFiqUNrDYOVg.text: Ask for CJ or TJ. I can never remember which he goes by but super nice and will do anything to make your experience great.

99fJTickEv2545I9-bEuAQ.text: My last time here (and I DO mean last time), they had lost control of their own establishment.  They couldn't get you a table or tell you how long it would be.  You were supposed to wade into the crowd and commandeer your own table.  And then, best of luck getting service.  If this is your only option for a night out, stay home.  I hope it let's me vote no stars.  One star is WAY too many.

WJQ5JF2ltFz_6GXZw0iGcA.text: I'll be honest- I love Whiskey's rooftop and the $4 Jack. Not a big whiskey drinker but I always order it while I'm here. The food is not good here. I've order several items and they're literally a waste of money. The tenders are always soft never crispy. The wings lack salt or any seasoning really. If you don't order them extra crispy some will be undone. The burgers also have no flavor. I'll continue to come here and I'm still going to give them 3 stars but the food is a waste of money and time. It's still love tho

jSXY6QnKx-gCz_Pp94f88g.text: I went to Whiskey Warehouse to watch the Superbowl and thought it was a decent place to hang out, but nothing special.  We were seated pretty quickly which impressed me given that it was a busy night and we showed up a little bit before kickoff. Our waitress and service was great, but I wasn't blown away by the drink and food options. While the whiskey menu is extensive, the beer selection is lacking and quite pricey.  The rooftop bar seems like a chill place to hang in summer, so I might be back for that!

eWxXj-wg1F46u_nT2E6KPA.text: INFESTED WITH COCKROACHES. An example would be that I came here3 times over an 8 month span and every single time there has been so many cockroaches crawling around the tables, bar and floor. I told my waitress and she smiled then walked away. Told the manager and she gave the same bs story as 8 months ago. (Oh and $10 for 5 wings...)   Used to be an awesome place but gone down hill

_tYFpMpZj-IrasTdqm_usw.text: I've been to Whiskey Warehouse a few times over the past year, and I have never really been blown away by anything. They have a pretty cool vibe going on with a country-western/roadhouse type theme. Also they have three main sections in the building with the main dining room, the "Single Barrel Room", and the rooftop bar.  The main dining room is always packed and loud, and can be a good place to catch a sporting event. The Single Barrel Room is usually a little quieter and has a separate bar (although no drafts on tap). They have tables, but they also have couches and comfy chairs if you're just looking to lounge and have a few drinks, and TVs are still in abundance for sports viewing. Upstairs on the rooftop is where I frequent the most. They have a great view of uptown, a relatively good amount of seating, and also some TVs over the bar. Overall, a really cool place to go.  However... I have never had an amazing experience here. The service is always fairly slow and inattentive, and I feel like a lot of the menu items are over priced. They have a good selection of bar food and appetizers, but it's tough to find anything for less than $10. The most appalling thing to me is the price of beer. NoDa's "Hop, Drop, 'n' Roll" is one of my favorite beers, and a 16-oz can will run you $9. WHOA! It's tough for me to justify going to have a couple of drinks and an appetizer with friends and forking over close to $40 with tip.  Definitely a fun place to go, but make it a special occasion, and be sure to save up for it.

67-HmRqeDU000YNMza_u1g.text: I feel weird writing a review on Whiskey, because i've been coming here consistently from day one!  It's probably my favorite bar in Charlotte....that doubles as a good restaurant.  Most places that have this type of bar setting and tv's for sports, tend to slack off on the food prep.  That is not the case here!  I've tried probably 15/20 menu items at this point, counting specials, lunch, brunch and dinner and i'm always pleased!  Some of my favorite items are: Buffalo Chicken Wrap, switching the Buffalo sauce for Honey BBQ. Warehouse Burger and fries Pimento Cheese App Fried Chicken tenders in Honey BBQ Prime Rib Sandwich.  Also, you can't beat $4 Jacks and their Bloody Mary bar on weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner menu

x11SrxHTP_V3C5wBBN-O4Q.text: The New Years experience for 2019 was not great! The year before was so fun with the DJ , the dance floor, and the champagne toast. I'm super disappointed with the changes.

qCHD5c-C6Kk_ORkF9gT_ZQ.text: Great spot, awesome views, nice outdoor patio. Terrible bartenders upstairs. Unfortunately the only bartender who knows what they are doing, it was her last day! Tried asking  another bartender (the brunette with bird tattoos on her shoulders) for a straw and was guilt tripped for not trying to "save the sea turtles" when there are 500 unwrapped straws an arms length away from the bartender. Didn't receive the straw until the couple next to me asked for 2 straws and she finally caved and gave us straws and then proceeded to give me dirty looks for the entirety of the night. First time visit and never returning thanks to her. Disappointing when bartenders don't care to take of their guests, especially over something so trivial.

z2oMAPDwzkGgBE2K2VSgcA.text: ROLL TIDE! I am a frequent customer her on Saturdays in the fall. There are always games on the tvs, drinks flowing, and great food being served. I live within walking distance and I always have a great time here. The Bloody Mary bar is the BEST in Charlotte and you can't beat their chicken and waffles. Burgers are good, lemon pepper wings are great! Service can be slow during busy times, which is expected but overall I always have a great experience. Plus their rooftop is amazing!! The views of the city are beautiful!

gVRFCAZR8i9VseURgfyZww.text: This was my first time visiting, I found this restaurant through Instagram #clteats. I was so excited to try the Grilled Tenderloin w/ garlic cream sauce, broccoli and rice. It wasn't on the menu but the staff and the Kitchen manager Chris was so awesome he made especially for me since it was my first time. The food was amazing. Definitely try this place!

Get the fried pimento cheese balls and the salt and pepper pork rinds to go with your drinks. x5BrYNWXJAxvZAvC3MZAcQ.text: We really like the rooftop bar here. In a strange kind of way, they have different beer selections upstairs and downstairs, so you might have to go up and down. While we loved the open air rooftop, the downstairs is rather dark and dingy during the day.

08h7JjNvX5lwFJq4fD_URA.text: In town for the Alabama game spending the beautiful night on the patio with the AMAZING Sara. She was very attentive even with how busy it was! Everything she suggested was delicious, food & drink alike. I will definitely be back but only if Sara serves me!

bYVmBqpU3KoKKG73iX_3ZQ.text: This is a really cool place for a snack, meal, or drinks because of their rustic decor and especially because of their rooftop view of the Queen City -- the rooftop is full service so you can eat and drink... or just drink! I recommend this place for the view, the mac 'n cheese (delicious!!) and their perfectly seasoned and cooked fries!

RNToJ0aG-1mB2A102Qxksw.text: Went here last night around 6:30, after my fiance came home from work. They do not have a lot of parking (shared parking with common market), and I notice some people parking in the post office lot. We actually found a spot pretty quickly, I think it was like the fourth spot in. Anyways, we were greeted as soon as we walked in. She offered inside or outside (rooftop). It was a little brisk for me so we chose inside. We were sat at a booth and within a minute our waitress came over. She was nice, but low spoken so sometimes I didn't even hear what she was saying. The music was a bit loud too, I felt like I had to yell during my conversation. But they had a TON of televisions, which was good because we wanted to see the end of the 4 o'clock games. We both ordered a salad (mine was a house and he chose the ceasar). We both ordered the wings, last time we came was a whiiiillleee back and their menu changed just a little. The fries did not come with the wings but now they do!! The fries are good! Natural cut and not burnt or crispy. I loved them. And the wings were good, needed a little more sauce but you can always ask for more.   Overall, the food was good for "bar food". The server was a little shy - or soft spoken, or maybe both- but she was nice and checked on us several times.   I will most definitely be back!

YYsSLV_5M8oA_n0pA24mKw.text: Been here many times and love the rooftop patio views! Came with some friends for the Alabama game and sat at the downstairs bar.  This experience was just ok - we were served beers in hot (fresh from the dryer) glasses which made them immediately warm :-/ The nachos were just alright and the buffalo wrap left a lot to be desired.  Great for a fun atmosphere with friends, but not the best food.

QdAkH4bKVCYOCA0eBMse3Q.text: I love this place. I always have a great experience when I come here. I mainly come for brunch and the chicken and waffles is awesome! The sausage gravy is what makes it so good! I also enjoy their mimosas and Bloody Mary bar. The Bloody Mary bar has a great selection of mixes and toppings. I've also had their wings with the Jack Daniels sauce and their burger and they are both great!

Ag8manClXkDJHJ5J1g76mg.text: Got asked for leave for no reason - this place sucks   way better places to eat and drink in plaza  After receiving a snarky message from management I have decided to expand on the above review which was written hastily.  On Saturday evening multiple parties of a conjoining friend group arrived at this establishment around 7:30pm. After ordering drinks and food, a member of one of the tables who suffers with a disability began playing with a container of ketchup she was given. She accidentally let it fall over the rail and some of it fell on the bouncer. Unaware of the situation, the 15+ member party was shocked to find their bouncer yelling and threateningly the young woman in the party. Shortly afterwards the poor waitress was told to throw everyone out (even members of the party at a different table completely unaware of what had happened). After a brazen attempt to box our food (and they made sure they got money out of us), they forced everyone to leave. Management never asked what had happened and the waitress looked incredibly uncomfortable.  After posting the review and receiving a self righteous message from management I will stand behind this review in its entirety because the situation, while understandable from the other side, was handled without much tact. I am sure that many members of the party after feeling disrespected will not be returning.  As for food and drink, average at best. There are excellent restaurants and fun bars in the area, I would steer clear of this establishment as they blindly listen to aggressive bouncers instead of patrons.

BYLpT08fXLLPVvZXa349CA.text: I've been here a few times and overall the food and service has been good.  The outside deck is really cool and the $4 jack drinks are awesome too.  The beer selection is also really nice.

egyoKTsfeuUWeyGJFm-Y1w.text: Pretzel with cheese and mustard great flavor, crispy and nice and soft.  Whisky mac hamburger okay, asked for med rare, got very well done.  Liked the Bloody Mary bar, 5 dollar for a glass, 3 for a virgin. I had the sweet potato fries, very crispy.   Wings are not jumbo as advertised on menu. Over fried and dry. Better get it with ranch to hydrate it.   Salad not worth 9 dollars, a handful of roman lettuce with three thin slices of avocado.  Good place to hang out on the roof top with friends for drinks. Typical bar food. Just okay.

K6RMBu71PS7h82Oqfgp3fA.text: Me and my husband came here for the first time a few days ago, and it was a pleasant experience.  We sat on the rooftop (it's a good view but it is a little bit obstructed by trees). It was a hot day, but they had fans out there that kept us cool. The service was good, and the food was awesome. I only give it 4 stars due to it being really slow - which we normally don't mind, but it wasn't busy at all and it took 15 minutes for me to get my Bloody Mary.  But other than that, our experience was great. I recommend getting the chicken nachos, and definitely try their Mac & Cheese - It's worth the $2 extra dollars.

HHvRmmcw0pEbpltJGRJj9g.text: Very disappointed with my meal today. This is what I was served when I ordered garlic parmesan boneless wings.  When I asked my server if this how this dish normally comes out, she said yes. I can't believe they let this leave the kitchen.

9Cq2dsEyg7m5Hvz-tOBT6Q.text: I have been hearing about the great patio at Whiskey Warehouse; so I decided tonight was the night I was going to check it out. I had a great experience with my bartender Chrissy; she was so friendly & had great customer service (you don't see that anymore) with all her bar guests. She really made me feel welcome!! I will definitely be coming back to here to see Chrissy!!

FoYFKnZJTMHQrxOh3pFe_Q.text: Waitresses got GREAT tits. Service slow AF doe! But them titties bouncing almost makes up for it.

VIUudEz0zayIYGM_S7V1Kw.text: My reivew is based off of only the roof top bar area.  What I do like about this place is that it's hoppin-and-poppin with people.  The pretty, the ugly and all us in between.  They made STRONG drinks too.  I should probably put that in the "what I don't like" section.  I'm 30ish..strong drinks are never good for me.    What I didn't like was the CROWDED roof top.  You couldn't put your arms in the air and wave'em like you just don't care even if you wanted to.  People stepping on my toes was fun.  Just too crowded for my taste.  Gosh I sound old.

4LWXGka4N-pRSjJpA-DiJg.text: Good location in plaza midwood. Enjoyed some beers & buffalo shrimp. Look forward to going back for prime rib night & to check out the roof when it warms up

kDHAQwg9LXmJpVRl_TRToA.text: Not much of a bar person as I find the noise level ridiculously loud and one ends up screaming to have a conversation, but to my friend's suggestion I decided to go anyway and chill. Well I was not surprised but what really turned me off were those awful things they served; the dreaded chicken wings. How can anyone "eff up" chicken wings. These were unsavory and the garlic Parmesan are not to be bothered with. Go for the social atmosphere and have a brew/pint but leave it to just that only.

2LW0EOH9QUrEXwtI1lXHUA.text: We visited the Whiskey Warehouse for the first time this past Sunday night.  Parking wasn't ideal (or well-defined), but we found a spot (or made our own).  Upon entering, we were impressed by the look, atmosphere, and wide-open space of the restaurant.  It was very inviting, fun, and alive with energy.  Our server was great, too, and she reminded me a bit of Rachael Ray -- both in her smile and her voice.    We got a great booth on the side of the restaurant (although I would have also have been happy at one of their several high-tops.)  I ordered a Bratwurst Sandwich from the "Local Food Section" of the menu.  For $1 extra, I substituted sweet potato fries for regular.  The bratwurst was delicious, topped with grilled onions and peppers, and so full of flavor.  It was just the right size, too, so I didn't feel overstuffed.  My partner on the other hand ordered the Southern Chicken sandwich -- a fried chicken breast with pimento cheese and bacon.  It was freakin' HUGE and a damn good value.  He couldn't even finish it all.  The sweet potato fries were delicious, too!  I also enjoyed watching the drunk sports fanatic at the table next to us who moved in very slow motion and tried to hold his head up the whole time we were there.  He was quite entertaining.   Lastly, if you're into whiskey (unfortunately, I'm not), they have a fantastic selection of brands for you to try.     We'll definitely return for a fun, casual night out.  I'd love to try their upstairs, outdoor seating/bar when it warms up again.

Uy2aFknZkOwevCckeuNE3g.text: So this was my first time here , we walked in saw a giant cockroach on the stairs. Went up to the patio to eat and drink , halfway through our meal we saw another giant cockroach ON OUR FOOD. Then we saw two more under our chairs. We first spoke to the waitress and she told us that it's normal because we are outside. We then asked for the manager and he also told us it was normal and there's nothing they can do about it because we were outside. They only discounted $5 off of our $60 dollar tab that we didn't finish because we were disgusted. After we paid our waitress simply told us to "have a good one" and walked away. We are still disgusted since we saw a total of 6 cockroaches one of them being literally in our boneless wing. DONT EAT HERE.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our extra protein in our meal.

62SdmqI8724STyRYR9rwSg.text: Stopped in for drinks on Saturday afternoon and sat up on the rooftop at the bar. Didn't order food as we had just finished brunch and we're looking for a scenery change. Absolutely enjoyed everything. Had multiple drink specials, all the college games on and had great service with multiple bartenders working. The food looked and smelled good and would definitely try them out for a meal

Z7tsLKbWxZwKJc4kFiOmRg.text: This place is great.  Awesome staff, great specials and solid bar food.  One of the best spots to grab a drink and watch a game.

-I1SJYVPW5MmDL863_yNfQ.text: Every Thursday is prime rib night. Fantastic price and good quality.  Queen cut around $12 and King's cut 14. Great rooftop bar over looking the CLT

-ZImhIr5_Siuni5ckeF9WA.text: I moved to the Charlotte area about the same time Whiskey Warehouse opened.   My first experience was not so great...  An over-crowded NFL playoff game.  Since that time, ALL of my experiences have been fantastic.   The management and staff there do an amazing job.   Sam, the executive chef, also does a fantastic job.   As a new person to the QC in 2010, Whiskey became my home away from home....   Most of the friends I have here are a direct result of my times eating and drinking at the Whiskey Warehouse.

XAje9IRxFjSgck5u79XaYg.text: Your typical Charlotte bar. Brussel sprouts can be delicious but the kitchen is extremely inconsistent. Probably won't go back for more than drinks.

ldlXWxoJZzx_qg-o7jmhQA.text: I frequently visit Whiskey. Not only do I love the food but the service is amazing. Mischa always makes it point to come over and see how we're doing. Best neighborhood bar there is!!!

gpQuR20qnC3WDltZi6KV6g.text: I like a lot of things about this place. I mostly come here to watch football with a group. They have a ton of tvs. The food is pretty good too for bar food. The giant soft pretzel is great but the cheese it comes with isn't so great. The Whiskey poppers are awesome.  They have an OK selection of local beers. Wish they had more. The upstairs outside patio is really great in the summer time. Good size bar with tvs and areas around the bar to hang out.  One thing I hate about this place is their policy for taking reservations on football Sunday. It's pretty ridiculous. They won't take a reservation for noon or later. So if I want to reserve a table for 6 I have to have everyone there at like 11:45 to get a reservation. That really makes zero sense. Why can't I reserve the table at 1:00? Or even 12:30. I don't get it.

-SgRniTq_N0vTRjzLmZd7g.text: Good selection of drinks. Food was decent for bar food, but at 10 pm they cranked the music to a volume so loud I could hardly hear my friends across the table. Waited a while for service as well. Solid meh.

sM0cqDXVVFbxZmHTZN2tgQ.text: They have indoor (downstairs) and outdoor (upstairs) seating. They have build your own bloody Marys and decent food. I really liked the buffalo chicken wrap and the chicken wings. The upstairs patio is a pretty good size and has its own bar.

vfZAKELoMZVEbKvpn6MJuQ.text: S-L-O-W. By far the slowest service I've ever had in any restaurant. From the drink order, to letting me know my drink wasn't available, to taking our order, & then the longest wait...getting the food! We waited about an hour for wings. WINGS! And we were one of the few people eating here. Super empty. We had ordered other things & literally asked for boxes bc we were just over it by the time it arrived. Oh & btw, one of those items was a cold salad requiring no cooking. We were also disappointed that their rooftop was closed until 4. I will say the long awaited wings tasted pretty good, but even that is not enough to bring me back here. Do not recommend!

_NqFRbJV9V9IgGk3XV8SJg.text: My New Favorite Bar in Charlotte....  What's not to like about this spot? Whiskey Warehouse is the rare bar that perfectly mixes the concoction of bar, food, screens, service, patio-area/view and overall ambiance that make any bar worth going to.  Bar: Every time I've been here they have had some sort of beer special; from $2 bud lites, to $3 micro brews, to $4 Jack Daniels you-call-its.  R.B.V.s are also reasonably priced around $18 for two, which is more than straight.  Food:  I can honestly say this place has some of the best bar food anywhere in Charlotte - for real.  I have eaten here multiple times and everything I have had has been awesome.  I recently had the Monterrey Chicken Sandwich, which I can say was hands-down one of the best chicken sandwiches I have ever had - every sandwich should have pepper-jack cheese and guacamole!  I have also had the wings here on multiple occasions.  The wings always come well sauced, meaty, well cooked, and with a cold, thick ranch.  If you've read my other reviews, then you know how important it is to me that they char their wings.  That's right folks, the wings are thrown on a grill for a min before they bring them out to you.  I had the chance to eat brunch here last Sunday, and I have to stay I was thoroughly impressed.  The toast was a little undercooked, but otherwise the scrambled eggs and bacon were up to par.    Screens: I love the fact that they have plenty of television screens littered and hanging from every corner of this bar.  Even when you go upstairs to the gorgeous rooftop patio, they have plenty of television screens embedded within the bar area.     Patio/View: Speaking of the rooftop patio - @ WW you will find nothing short of the most SPECTACULAR and BREATHTAKING VIEW OF THE CHARLOTTE SKYLINE anywhere!  There is plenty of seating and they have full waitress and bar service.  I also appreciate the H20 mist they have cooling down the patrons at the bar.  Though BEWARE fellas, many ladies are leery of the mist interacting with their hair!  Service:  Great service.  My order has always been correct each time I've ordered food or drinks.   I am preferential to the bar staff simply because of easier access to drinks, and closer views of the television screens.    I've tried to come up with something not to like about this place and I can't.  Prices are reasonable.  Though tight, they do indeed have a parking lot.  I meant what I said to start this review, I love Whiskey Warehouse, its my new favorite bar in Charlotte and I will def be back - hope to see you there!  PS: FYI: Monday WW has 1/2 price wings.  They serve brunch on Sunday's starting at 11am!  $3 bloody Mary's on SUNDAYS!!!

JfVMHJmdII5Q9hbh1v7fVg.text: EVERYTHING I COULD HAVE DREAMED OF! The food was delicious and probably the best brunch spot I've ever had. Simply left speechless and happy. Will definitely be back!

Rc7Ufx3dytW7VwSMlhTXow.text: I've been here for drinks several times, but CLT Burger Week has me stopping in to try their burger.  And it was good!   Giant burger with caramelized onions, mushrooms, smoked ketchup and blue cheese crisps. Mmmmmmm it was tasty!   I'll be back to try their other burgers too!

QgTLqOkbFb3ni_qtsRHNZA.text: My husband and I are Bourbon enthusiasts, and we have wanted to check out this place for a long time. We were in the area on Saturday and finally took the opportunity to check this one off our list. We started our order with a Jefferson flight that included Jefferson Small Batch, Jefferson Reserve, and Jefferson Ocean.  It was $17.  I've been curious about Jefferson Ocean, but never wanted to fork over $100 for a whole bottle without tasting it first.  IMHO, bourbon doesn't have to cost a small fortune to be great.  I'm glad I waited because I preferred the taste of the Small Batch best. We also ordered a Jack & Coke, which were on special for $4.  It was a perfectly balanced cocktail.  The coke was sweet, and the Jack wasn't watered down or too strong.  (You would think it would be simple enough to never get wrong, but many bars do.). In case you aren't a whiskey fan, they also had double Mimosas and Bloody Mary's on special for $5.   I ordered the BBQ pork plate. The meat was moist and seasoned well. It does have some heat to it, but not so much that it overpowered the taste of the pork.  I didn't try the slaw, but it was well presented and looked good. I substituted Mac-n-cheese for fries, and they came out hot and crispy.  My hubby ordered the fish and chips, and he was also very happy with his food.  He said the fish was moist and well seasoned.   What really impressed us about this place was the exception customer service we received. Our server patiently answered our questions and checked back frequently to make sure we had everything we needed. It was a very pleasant experience and we will definitely go back for the Saturday specials!

zw3naT7_tsRfZa67zabfNg.text: Ordered a Jameson & Ginger but definitely came back as some whiskey that tasted rather rail. Bartender made the drink on the other side of the bar when the Jameson was sitting right in front of us. Whatever she used cost us $19...  Pretty good city views, with big TVs which are perfect for game day.   Will give this another shot once I move here.

kBMB7EYjt-6Yst3Uz_ZTbA.text: Met a friend for drinks and dinner and sat in the speakeasy styled bar in the back.  The staff was more interested in folks sitting at the bar.  We both ordered Steak and Potatoes and it was a sad experience.  The steak was not cooked as we'd requested (got well done and asked for medium) and it was cut into large chunks!  So large chunks of well done meat.  UGH!  The potatoes were the deep fried chunks (clearly a theme here) of potatoes like the airports serve.  It was not worth the price!  The drinks were the only good thing here!  Will not return just based on the service and the poor attention to details.  Don't use "we're busy and have a small kitchen" as an excuse.  Then craft your menu to what you CAN do well!

OaA5_gd5bcn4kZN_MqzZUg.text: I came in on St. Patrick's day. The manager said that they couldn't serve food because the kitchen was too small. The top floor was full but the bottom floor was pretty empty. How is the kitchen not big enough to serve the building below capacity?!!!!!!

980r5duTFjSWEubMT06ogA.text: I took a friend out for a birthday dinner before a party and we ordered several appetizers and a pitcher of White Sangria! The Sangria was not on the menu but it's one of my favorite drinks so we asked if they had it and the waitress confirmed, They do have white and red Sangria! ( I should have asked for the price it was $35 for the pitcher "insert dramatic gasp") We ordered the white sangria, meatballs, steak bites, pan Nachos, and Buffalo Shrimp! I throughly enjoyed the buffalo shrimp and we had enough to take home half an order. I also would recommend the steak bites! The nachos were pretty good! We sent the meatballs back as my friend stated the meat didn't taste like beef. I didn't personally try them! Overall, our server was pleasant  and the service was acceptable even with a full house! I have a tomato allergy so the waitress was super attentive to that detail and helped to customize what we ordered!

CZR-YAmsY0FFfXgVgIBYtg.text: First let me say, I have never eaten here. I have visited multiple times for drinks and views in the evening and have been there once during the day for cocktails. The environment fits in with plaza with a typically prep pier leaning crowd for the area. I love the rooftop and the views it has. Limited parking is available on a pull through drive next to it. But is very very rare. Most visits I did not notice the staff or service meaning it was totally fine and not noteworthy. Sadly, this last visit, the staff was extremely disappointing. I went last Friday around 4pm. I sat on the roof with a dozen coworkers. Although there were 3-5 staff/bartenders at the bar the entire 2 hours we were there and around 4 other patrons, it's took 5-15 minutes to get any of their attention. They were standing within 6 feet of us and when we would come up to the bar, none of them would male eye contact. Eventually a blonde server would usually help us, reluctantly. She seemed very annoyed by all requests.   I will continue to patron here for late nights but do not plan to hang out here when I'm looking to be treated nicely and timely.

aIpUIeaVBe3oCvC9dndX8Q.text: You ever want to not review a place because you fear that other's will find out it's awesome? ... Yeah, I guess that's why I've been holding off on reviewing Whiskey Warehouse. Either that or I'm a procrastinator. Here's the top three reason why Whiskey Warehouse is favored so dearly by me:  1. Wings The wings are some of the best "traditional" wings I've had in Charlotte and I've committed to finding good wings where ever I live. Wings over Everything! Wings (and ball) is Life! ... Anyway, there's a ton of good options in terms of sauce or dry rub. My top three choices are: Lemon Pepper, Parmesan Garlic and BBQ (tangy deliciousness). The wings are meaty and crispy and never disappoint. I usually go for all drums because all wing connoisseurs know the drums are the best.  2. Value / Happy Hour Love wings but balling on a budget? ... 1/2 price apps Monday through Friday. All the wing goodness, half the price! I guess there's other apps to try but I would stress focusing on the wings. .. Love whiskey! Of course you do! What else would you down your wings with? ... Well my friend / stranger reading this review there's $4 Jack Daniels drinks just for you (or anybody else with $4). Can't go wrong there. There's tons of other great whiskey to pick from at a very reasonable price.    3. Brunch on the Patio Sunday brunch ... you, your friends, a couple of flights of Mimosas for $12 or $2 glasses, a good selection of yummy eats ranging from pancakes to burgers and wings of course. what more could you ask for? ... You: What about a nice view of the Uptown skyline? ... Whiskey Warehouse: I got you fam. ... The patio give you all of that. If it's nice out, it might take you a little bit to grab a really good spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings. Garlic Parmesan up front, Lemon Pepper over yonder. Not pictured but oh so finger licking delicious is the Honey BBQ wings.

RXaN94Kc5Tr4YGlc1EDDJw.text: I've been here a few times now and it has not let me down! Whiskey warehouse has one of the next rooftop bars/seating areas in the Charlotte area. It's very spacious and of course, has a great view of the city!   The food has never disappointed. Some of my favorites are the buffalo chicken wrap, pimento cheese dip, and chicken Caesar salad. If you're in a pickle with making a decision, these three are always my go to and delicious! The menu is pretty big so I find myself being so indecisive more often than not, so it's always good to have your go tos. I always look forward to trying something different though if I am in the mood to expand my horizons :)   Drink specials are good for what I have seen. 2$ mimosas on Sunday's, 4$ for a double....can't go wrong with that! Overall drink prices aren't too bad, pretty normal for Charlotte. Service is always super friendly, dependent upon the day and how busy it is, it can be a little slow which is expected on busy weekend nights. But overall, I always look forward to coming back and trying new things and enjoying the rooftop!

VINQaiQmVFZqKBXt8rD_iA.text: We had so many problems this night I won't go back. It's a cool vibe, but the food was awful and the customer service was just as bad. We both got sandwiches. Both were cold and soggy. My sandwich was underwhelming even if it was hot. The fries were also cold and soggy. They messed up our side orders. Just BAD food all around! When we complained they did not care or do anything. So many better places in Plaza!

p8EUgxPoy1hDLr8Vif-ecw.text: 1 star for good location (rooftop bar with a view of the city) and for the selection of whiskey. I came with a small group for dinner tonight-we were able to get a table on the roof right away. It was a nice view of the sunset over the Uptown. Was not thrilled with much of anything else the rest of the night.  There is a great selection of bourbon/scotch at the bar downstairs/inside; but you cannot order any of them upstairs on the rooftop. That was disappointing.   We also had poor service (wouldn't see the waitress for 20 minutes at a time), drinks (both liquor and simply water) and food came out SUPER slow.  Last thing, one friend at the table ordered salmon-which came out completely raw. Besides the fact that neither waitress or manager offered up an apology, the manager actually took the salmon back to the kitchen to cook it longer, asking "if that was ok, rather than bringing out a fresh piece of fish". Will not be back.

UPMdiqN30V71DNyLYmMWgw.text: High energy environment last night during the game!!! I really enjoyed it! My crown Apple and cranberry was amazing! Thanks to the bartender. The appetizers were decent. Our waitress needs to really work on being more social. She was very dry.

D5Jmk48V7n6kN6HZjO1S0Q.text: Love it! Came here with friends to relax and watch the game. Upper patio has a great breeze for these summer nights.
