RFuHRENoc74xm05jgZfLiQ.text: If I could give less than one star, I would. Watched a very over served man continue to be served, then get in his car and drive. We simply went to get a drink and the bartender was clueless. We ordered old fashioneds, and she said "we're out of bitters, well maybe, I think". I'm in a bar called Whiskey Warehouse, and you don't have bitters. She attempted to make two drinks for us anyway, one was all water and a cherry thrown in, not drinkable. The other was a half pour of a whiskey that was not what I requested or paid for. It's no wonder everyone around us was drinking wine or beer. Never going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sad excuse for a drink.

9O8iDf7eAzoWNvhtLuvTPQ.text: If it's one thing I hate, it is being ignored when I'm trying to give your establishment my money. I'm literally standing at the hostess desk waiting to be helped and instead of getting a "I'll be with you in just a minute" the hostess stands there and continues having a personal conversation. Then she helps someone else and then goes back to having what seems like another personal conversation with someone else. I'm big on customer service and this wasn't worth my money so I dipped. Probably won't be back.

Y8za9qpMk6XmfiS4dKRYLg.text: Whiskey warehouse is a great bar ANY day of the week. The drink specials are cheap and plentiful ($4 jack all most all the time) and they usually are well staffed with well trained, well mannered servers. It's in a part of Charlotte that is growing with new housing and cool bars/dives every week. The ambience is the regular sports bar with a bit more room for larger parties and sit down eating on the main level. On the second level -my personal favorite- is the patio! Equipped with plenty of tv's, lots of table top seating, bar stool options, a nice view of downtown and an added bonus is that they have bathrooms upstairs so you don't have to go up and down while having drinks. Also the bathrooms are not a run down toilet shack but really well put together. They have great food options and the wings are amazing !

WiipmVCfZDrpyoSxOH_iBQ.text: Not blown away, but they do have a pretty great rooftop bar, and plenty of TVs around for viewing whatever game you please. It was admittedly a great choice to watch UNC barely beat the Razorbacks. They have a relatively standard selection of beer, and unfortunately their menu wasn't updated at all when we went there and several taps were completely empty.Service was great the whole night though!  I ordered the spicy teryaki wings, and I think that I have several personal preferences that were not met: I do like a thicker sauce (this one was watery), I get a bit upset when I see entire halves of wings not covered in sauce (this means they weren't tossed and the sauce was just drizzled on), and I also like crispy skin (this was definitely soggy). But the meat was hot and there was a fair amount of it!  I also ordered a side of fries and holy cow those were DRENCHED in grease and totally soggy. Every single one of them. And there wasn't any salt either...  So although the food was on the lower side of OK, I did enjoy the atmosphere, and I'll continue to come here... I may have just come on an off day. I'll come back and try more things, and hopefully be able to bump up my experience.

8d103O5qmnpBUIifYaKEPA.text: If you like whiskey and bar food this place is perfect for you. Service is as expected for a bar scene, but the menu makes up for it. The warehouse offers a great selection of American style foods in addition to an adventurous brunch menu. I'd like to see them offer cheaper jack and cokes because they are $4 everywhere else. Trust me, I've traveled, and drank, plenty. Overall a great restaurant for all ages especially post college.

7Y-aRgrpTQGnNS8ESR5q9Q.text: This place was a disappointment. Came in on a Saturday, and they had Jack Daniel's special, which was great because I like Jack, but the food was so-so. My colleague ordered the Salmon salad, and the salmon portion was so small, it was ridiculous. A 3 oz piece of salmon on top of some lettuce and walnuts for $14?!?! I thought that was a bit overpriced. Although he did say it was delicious. Another colleague ordered the chicken pasta, and he said that the pasta itself did not have any flavor, but the chicken did. My pulled pork sandwich was not bad, but again, nothing special.

uEwbIz6HP99ZcPe1_GsQCA.text: Fun music, good late night pretzel I didn't need, great crowd, service could be bettered by having more staff so the servers aren't rubbing around insane though. Overall really good atmosphere.

Rl5-Z7vaGSp29UT4t1-IZA.text: First of all I should say I have never actually eaten at whiskey warehouse, because the wait is always inevitably too long. However it is always fun to enjoy drink on the top deck. We frequently get a pitcher of drinks to drink an every time have been impressed with how much alcohol they pack in for us! You certainly get your money's worth! If you are looking for a place to chill with friends and enjoy drinks, whiskey warehouse is busy and loud but can be a fun scene.

zMUUGzM-MhR_Vln0mognAg.text: 3-star is generous, it's more like 2.5-star for my recent visit on Thursday  to meet friends for drinks.  The place was pretty packed for 9pm.  The 4 of us got some appetizers.  Nachos was HORRIBLE.  For $8, it definitely did not worth the price.  Can't believe I'm going to say this, but I would rather go to Taco Hell (I mean Bell) and get nacho there.  The pimento cheese spread was ok, look a little odd since it was mostly shredded cheese.  It had a little kick to it.  Not sure tortilla chips is the best companion for it... The best was the fried cheese balls.    We ordered wine that night, it was half-price bottle night.  Same as my original review, nothing to complain about the drinks.    Now on to service.  It was fine for the most part.  And just when you think something improved, one of the 3 waitresses that served our table (and she acted like she's the more "senior" of the 3) came over at 11ish, stopped us in the middle of our conversation and asked if we could tap out because she would much rather go home.  REALLY?!  Here's a news flash: how about get your rude & lazy butt home and let someone else finish out our table and get the tips that you obviously didn't deserve.  I worked in restaurants before, I waited tables, so I'm not just talking out of a pie hole with no merit.  That just totally rubbed me the wrong way.    All these months later, food was still so-so (super sub-par for nacho... a bar food staple that's really not hard to master) and the service still needed improvement.

Ro8JcT7LRPgz5ZnG375HtA.text: I love the fairly new rooftop patio here - just awesome! My only complaint is that you cannot get food service there. I will say the bartenders were very accommodating and friendly.   We went downstairs (after about a 10 minute wait) to get a table for 6. 15 minutes later no one even greeted us - I asked a nearby server if she was ours and she replied no, I then asked if she would get the server who was ours. 10 minutes later still nothing so I went back to the hostess who about 10 minutes later sent over that original server who claimed we weren't hers. If they were really busy I might have understood but we watched our "server" flirt with several guys at the bar and then stand around and chit-chat at the hostess station. After I explained to her that we would be leaving she just lamely said "oh sorry" . We went over to Jacks where the service was fantastic. I think management really needs to work on giving great service because they missed out on 6 dinners and several drinks...not to mention I may think twice about going there on game-day due to poor service.

jfioDvjp6ihL5am59CrDmw.text: Fun, cheap, exactly what I expected, the roof is cool. The staff is friendly and attractive, specifically the bartenders...they were fast and nice to me. Thank you. And thank you place.

BujRluNbpFsl7SaSVAl9_A.text: Great Wings and Great Drinks! Roof top service is on point. My regular Monday night stop!

oU4j04-xi1r10w1Y-XgLsQ.text: This place gets 5 stars from me. We have been here 3 times this year and each time it has been great, great atmosphere to celebrate my hubbys bday. Great servers and drinks too

a3Mc6qG1pP1riQYSHumfUA.text: We had a large group Saturday night, and were seated on the rooftop.  Great views and comfortable seating.  There were mixed comments from the group about their food.  Pimento poppers were great.  My hamburger was forgotten, and when it came they had overcooked it.  But, to their credit, a manager came over as soon as they realized it was late and they comped it. So, overall, a mixed bag, but we would give it another chance.

P5RoJmMO5CMiVURVWW7djg.text: I'm going to start this off by saying - to be fair, I came here after an event that was partially sponsored by this place, therefore it was SUPER busy. And from what I experienced, there wasn't a ton of parking, which is always annoying.  Because it was super busy - our service was pretty terrible & I feel like they could have prepared better, knowing there would be a rush of people coming in. I think on a more "regular" night, the service might be better & I'll for sure give them a second chance.  After waiting over an hour for my food (a salad), the order was wrong (I asked for two things to be removed & they were not) and the food was just sub-par.  One really GREAT thing about Whiskey Warehouse is their roofdeck...amazing view of the Charlotte Skyline! I plan to go back some night this summer & give them a second chance & enjoy the rooftop scenery!

crye4-8ofzd6LHEvHSe0Eg.text: Amazing food, great location. We tried sitting on the rooftop, all seats were taken- get there early if you're planning to stay just for dinner. Had the teriyaki chicken, husband had the burger with fries. Teriyaki chicken was so delicious, may have been better than any hibachi restaurant version I've had. Husband said the fries were some of the best he's had... ever. Quality, local beer and great service. Will definitely be back!

1OW-Pst57-j1dlRH9UQwDg.text: I enjoy Whiskey Warehouse and come here often when my fiance wants a good bloody mary bar at his fingertips. While I do come here mostly to grab a drink and walk around Plaza Midwood, I have grabbed a bite or two before. The big fish sandwich is delicious (even though I got it bun-less) It was large, crispy, and definitely hit the spot. The wings are good as well, though once my lemon pepper ones, were a little too lemony for my taste, but good overall. In short we keep coming back for the atmosphere and drinks.

EgsMhDm-i0zQxkHWjdVXYQ.text: This is a great place to go after work. I love to go upstairs to the patio that overlooks uptown. The food is pretty good. It's typical bar food. The drinks are really good and inexpensive.

gTrgYVrQn9IR-O-DZpSwJQ.text: Solid neighborhood place to chill with friends or grab a good meal. I'm particularly fond of Sunday's when the bloody mary bar is set up. They've got a lot of TV's set up and play some good music. And ladies...it doesn't have a feel of a sports bar, so no worries there.   I've had the fish & chips here a few times and it's my go to meal. Not the best I've ever had, but let's be honest...it's fried fish and fried potatoes...score!

5uqexZkKMiKDYI7k8Nty7A.text: Good enough pub food with a kind of annoying attitude.  I was happy to see something go in to the space left by Creation.    I've been several times for supper or lunch with groups ranging from two to eight.  They have a burger with bacon and egg that is delicious, if freakishly messy, and what I usually get.  Their sweet potato fries are crispy and garlicky like I like them.  They have at least a couple of vegetarian options, although the one my partner gets usually would better be described as cheese sauce with a few vegetables over white rice (not unappealing, but not light or healthy in any way).    There are LOTS of TVs throughout the bar and next to each booth, although they are easy enough to ignore if you want to have a conversation.  There seems to be an extensive bar, although I've never tried it.  As for the attitude, this is a restaurant with roughly eight parking spaces during the day when other businesses in the area are open.  The restaurant has decided that a good use of one of those spaces, and the one closest to the door mind you, is as permanent parking of a testosterone surrogate muscle car.  God knows I'm all for attitude and funky, but not when it interferes with function.    The staff routinely park in the post office parking lot next door during business hours, which then leaves the post office without adequate parking.  WW's owners are adding a rooftop bar this winter, requiring even more parking.  There is a sense of entitlement and disdain for their neighbors that doesn't sit well with me.  If you are looking for a place to watch a game or for a bar at which to stop on the way home, you could do worse.  If you are looking for a good neighbor, you'll probably want to move on.

DHXTM11Yn9pLmfgltzy-uw.text: Came here on Saturday, severely understaffed. I waited 20 minutes at the bar and doesn't even get a hello. Decided to go across the street and got prompt service.

3Tbq48YijgkrZfxnfHA94Q.text: Met some friends here on Sunday for drinks and food.  I've stopped in here for drinks before but had never ordered any food.  They had bloody marys for $3, along with mimosa's, redneck mimosa's, and bud lights for $2.  I thought the redneck mimosa's were especially good; they are a mixture of lions head beer, orange juice, and a splash of ginger ale.    I'm not a huge salmon fan but the the salmon salad looked especially good for $9 and the chicken tenders were nicely breaded and very fresh.  I had the southern sandwich which consisted of a fried chicken breast on a bun with bacon, pimento cheese, lettuce, and tomato on top...great sandwich!

oh9VWbL9eMMV_z8IzaS7Vg.text: I met some friends for drinks at the rooftop bar area this weekend and was REALLY hungry.  I ordered the most convenient thing to eat which were the chicken tenders.  I was a skeptic while waiting thinking the food would just be mediocre given that it seems more of a drinking type place.  The tenders and fries came out piping hot and they were some of the best tenders I've ever had!  They were really crispy on the outside but very moist and tender on the inside.  I can't wait to go back and have them again.  Service and waitstaff were pretty on point.  Friendly and accommodating and fast.

Z9ahOulo654qtXctrowELg.text: It's a shame this place is getting such poor reviews.  I had a great experience here last Thurs. night the staff was more than friendly and how can you beat half priced wine by the glass or bottlev-that will bring me back any night.  I enjoyed the atmosphere and my whiskey shots.  I think this is a great place to bring a group for some cocktails.   This place has a lot of potential can't wait to come back and check out the menu and some more whiskey.

g4Mjg1eUSRoapSPbn-jhRQ.text: This place had an amazing roof top terrace.  I wish their food was as good as the view.  Food is mediocre unfortunately.  I ordered the chicken nachos.  Very sub-par.  Cheap tortilla chips, canned cheese, and pretty sure the salsa was from a jar. We really love coming to this place for drinks, I just wish the food was better.

jGJQV4aEjfY2TfCyjMd5tg.text: Great atmosphere and good food...that's affordable!  Don't forget to check out the rooftop area!

N4ztPjJQR4BQa9Qhv8kkxg.text: Sorry, they've failed again! Food is not good here. I've given this place multiple tries after bad experiences! Rooftop bar is great, food is not! I'm here again for Prime Rib night. Meat is just ok, baked potato wasn't cooked through! This happens regularly! So so disappointing! Bad thing is, they just don't care! I told my bartender (Molly) my issue with my crappy meal and she was nice, yet no manager came over to apologize or to try and rectify the situation! That seems to be the norm here, that the managers just don't care? I mean, even the busboy who took my plate, apologized, but not one manager came over?

9K8u1Gz_QXQiFN558Tk59A.text: Heard about these place from others so tried it out on New Year's....colossal mistake!  Probably would have hung out for the long wait but the dining hall looked like it was packed. Ok I expect that on NY's but looked like the tables were all slammed together. The bar was even worse. And don't even think about going up the stairs for that seating...reeked of urine!  Didn't even bother to drink here & not going back or referring anyone here!

l8y46TzEx001jtwEp7I0YQ.text: I've been wanting to try WW for years simply based on the looks of this place. The rooftop patio looks awesome from below and I think it has a view of the great Charlotte skyline. Anyway, I finally found a Saturday to grab lunch there with a friend, and in short, I look forward to my next visit. I ate in this building about 7-8 years ago when it was another restaurant (can't remember the name). The renovation changeover blew me away. I love what they did!! Very rustic and well done with plenty of seating options. It was a tad too cool to eat on the rooftop this day so that will be my next visit. Ok, onto the service and food. The place wasn't that packed so we got a table immediately. The waitress was very nice and we didn't wait long at all to have our orders taken. We each ordered cheeseburgers with fries. Fresh cut fries that is. Anyone that knows me will know hands down that good french fries will get me back for a second visit. WW has those fries. Seasoned just right and fresh tasting. The burgers were very good also even though the meat was a tad dry on mine. The only minor complaint I have was that it took almost a half hour to get our food after we ordered. The waitress kept telling us it would be soon. I definitely won't hold this against them. Even a well run restaurant has a difficult day now and then. Even then, I am usually not in a great hurry on Saturdays so it was ok with me. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

jZr6CQ6evPXOZCMpWCZpGw.text: A great place to watch the game.  Many 60 inch HD plasmas with great sight lines about anywhere you sit.  They have the usual selection of pub grub. The fries are better than average.

LFIGSbdoRBJO9j4BdRRLhg.text: The food sounded pretty good, but we never found out. We sat, ignored, for about 20 minutes before walking out.   We sat on the upstairs patio and were summarily ignored after being handed menus. The only attention we received was when we finally started walking back down the stairs, hungry and parched. But too little, too late. There are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood (with great service), don't waste your time here.

lmOTXppFUPu7GxoPm8SSbA.text: What a great place to come and eat and have a few drinks on top of the roof.  Make sure to get their early during weekend nights and Thursday and Friday nights if you want to sit at the roof top bar as it fills up very quickly.  It has a casual ambience so feel free to come with a t-shirt and flip flops.  They have a nice selection of food for anyone.  They have limited draft beer options since mainly bottles.  Parking is also an issue during busy times.  Park at Harris Teeter, the post office, or on the opposite corner if no spots are available.  Their prime rib is awesome and I am a huge fan of their wings.  I make sure to order them crispy and ask them to make it as hot as they can since their sauces aren't that hot.

bW0N1ixqv5k7QXUR0fxECQ.text: Well, it seems the potential for upscale whiskey bar is being squandered on the frattiest crowd ever to descend on Plaza/Midwood (which is saying a lot, considering the crowd TST draws). Since the cask beer is my main reason for coming here - and its seldom on tap - I'm giving up.   The parking in this area has always been tight but its been taken to a whole other level of screwed since WW opened. Harris Teeter and CVS have put towing programs into effect because patrons of this joint (and hey, others too, but no one really complained until, coincidentally, right after WW opened) are too lazy to park in the municipal lots scattered around the 'hood. Watch out driving by the place in the wee hours, too - you'll inevitably be lunged at by Turd Ferguson and the Misses, thinking you're the cab they called. Idiots.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. sweet.
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. awesome.

CKInepSnjNlU9aM--MNlBQ.text: This place is 5 stars in my book.  Always a decent drink special, good bar food, plenty of TVs, and an awesome rooftop bar with a nice view of Uptown.  The service has always been good too.  Whiskey is always an option when we're out and about in Midwood looking for a drink.

-MJvhEp77UtK1CECDFzYDw.text: I had a great time here but it had nothing to do with the bar. It's one peg up from an average sports bar, with Whiskey in the name to try and make it feel New Southern Hip. It doesn't work, but in their favor the $3.50 microbrew special ain't bad.

gRMVVm89h6vzOeQUcfonRw.text: You really have to know what time and day to visit a particular venue in Charlotte, especially one like this which at any given moment can be a family restaurant, a sports bar or a pickup joint.    When it's not full of yahoos, it's a really nice place from my experience today.  I got the Warehouse Burger and wasn't crazy about the BBQ sauce which tasted more like wing sauce (tart 'n spicy instead of rich 'n smoky).  But it was perfectly cooked and the bacon was crisp and tasty.  The waitress was attentive and knowledgeable.  And most importantly, True to their name, they have an obvious, albeit expensive selection of bourbon, whiskey and whisky that covers all the bases.  I'd give them four stars if they got rid of all the flat screen TV's and were in a location more suitable to the clientele that enjoys eating and drinking what's on their menu.  If we're lucky, when something else trendy and new opens up in PM, WW will mature into a really great spot.  Time will tell, so stay thirsty my friends...

pQ_QDjrYfq2oGmB4mFmXRA.text: We had a late lunch there today around 3pm. It was slow in the restaurant and the staff was all friendly and very chatty. Could've been somewhat faster service but it wasn't terribly slow. The buffalo chicken sandwich was good- the buffalo sauce was very peppery and delicious.

seSiIFZ3SH9H-YBG3LGlqA.text: We came here on a Friday for lunch and wanted to sit on the rooftop because the weather was beautiful. Unfortunately the rooftop isn't open durning the week until dinner time. Food is good but would have been nice to enjoy the nice weather and beautiful scenery the restaurant can but didn't offer.

DIk1xDmepBBGOmRJrVVL0g.text: I have to admit that I was skeptical when Whiskey Warehouse opened in the neighborhood where I live and work. I expected it to be a typical redneck sports bar kind of place full of obnoxious drunk people.  However, being that it's across the street from my office, it was so convenient that I really couldn't avoid checking it out. I ventured in a few times with friends for drinks and appetizers, and I never had a bad experience. (Well, okay, once the service wasn't fantastic in the upstairs "Top Shelf" roof bar.)  Last night, I was there for dinner with a companion for the first time. The service was very friendly, but they were out of the first bottle of wine we ordered, and then it took forever to get our meal. We weren't really in a hurry, so it wasn't a big deal, and when dinner came (tender, juicy ribs, perfectly seasoned cole slow, and crisp, delicious sweet potato fries) it was quite wonderful.  Here's the stunner. Even though we hadn't complained about the wait at all, our server notified the manager, Johnnalyn, of the situation, and she came right over to our table to apologize (explaining about the small kitchen size) and offer us a gift card for our next meal. Then came the bigger stunner. When our tab arrived, we had not been charged for our meal.  So here's why five stars. This is a restaurant that could get away with mediocre food and service, but instead delivers on both ends...including local food offerings (which I always appreciate) and the most professional and courteous management I've seen in a long time.

y1liyH5mnP93plB_y6gLgQ.text: I really want to like this place. Great atmosphere...love the upper deck. The appetizers are good. I highly  recommend the Buffalo Chicken Dip. However, do not expect quick, attentive service. It isn't happening. Also, I ordered the special, sirloin steak, medium rare and got medium well. I'll try this place again because I want to like it but it maybe a place you just settle for drinks & apps.

i2Vd-zXAvbcuDPzAhhHC5Q.text: Went to whiskey warehouse after reading reviews and guess what.... We waited an hour for food after asking 3 times.  We also had to ask for drinks more than once. The manager said it was being plated. He brought it up and it was cold.  All of our meals were cold.  The manager offered to replace but we were starving so we ate the meat.  He said he would comp or table tonight then tried to  charge us for drinks we ordered while waiting.  We were appalled when he came to the table and said "your going to tell me what your doing with your meal"  He then threw his hand up and said get out of here.  When we asked his name he followed us to the door saying his name. I have never been treated so disrespectful in my life.

M8I6g64u00upG4y-GYinvQ.text: If you are a female don't expect service. The Asian girl won't even mAke contact with you. Only nice girl was a bar back who couldn't get my beer but hovered the bartenders to attempt to get my beer. Girl bartenders suck!!!!

ElBIg5efQtk2MByvUq0iWQ.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles for brunch, as I have many times and today they cut back on the chicken.  Normally it has always been two chicken fingers on the waffle with sausage gravy, today they cut a chicken finger in half.... Really is half a chicken finger a thing.  You lost my business and I have eaten here for years

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Notice the half chicken finger on top..... Really is a half a chicken finger worth losing a customer

8PsxTNYjUZ9oJsF4idQzgA.text: Great rooftop view paired with amazing food! Definitely one of my favorite go-to spots in Charlotte!

ybDuE8sAWQu_4MoyeHEqbw.text: Excellent selection of Scotch, Whiskey and Bourbon!  Good pours for the price.  Knowledgable staff - they know what they got and got what they know!  Helped us learn even more about whiskeys, bourbons, and scotch.  Service is always friendly and attentive. Super fun gals!  The pimento cheese and chips Rocked! Yum!  Highly recommend Whiskey Warehouse!

HifG5LWcXb1w3yHlXa3ugg.text: I have to be honest....I came in here with pretty low expectations. With a name reminiscent of trashy college bars - I expected a lot less. It's actually like a classy version of a sports bar. We came at six on Friday for dinner after work. It has a great "chill out" atmosphere with great music. Also, a ton of tvs, extensive whiskey selection, and good service. The buffalo chicken dip was awesome. The wings were fall off the bone juicy, but the brisket was flat, dry, and overcooked. It did have really good flavor though.

5kSBNBcrnWy0KryxEipBhw.text: Such an amazing staff great food and customer service.  I travel across town almost every weekend to enjoy the great company and service.

wgXECF8f4sdg6B7UfpqL2A.text: Whiskey Warehouse could be a cool little joint if they offered a better beer selection and higher quality food. Decided to meet up with an out of town visitor for the skyline views at Whiskey this week. Unfortunately the awesome view wasn't enough to make up for the overpriced mediocre beer and subpar food.   Ordered the nachos on special during half priced apps (4-6) and what we  received was stale chips with under seasoned queso and a few slices of jalapenos with diced tomatoes. Pretty uninspired to be honest and definitely not worth the regular price of $11.   I would like to say I wouldn't return, but for some reason others seem to enjoy the rooftop bar enough to ignore the subpar food/overpriced drinks and I'm sure it won't be long before I begrudgingly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

LafEAl0xU0YJ0gjiM575xQ.text: Southern chicken is great, I added jalapeno Tabasco to give it an extra kick. The fries have a really good seasoning. The service was fast and friendly. I sat upstairs and enjoyed the shaded seats by the fan. Definitely coming back for brunch on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

ky_e1IC1b9T3IObCCveG7w.text: Wow. What a cool venue. $4 Jack Daniels whiskey all the time will certainly keep my husband coming back.  We came in as a group of 4 for dinner and drinks. One star off because it was too loud to have a good conversation but the food was decent bar food and came out quickly. The pretzels were delicious. My friend had the pasta dish for a simple $12 and coming from the northeast, that is unheard of! I could certainly get used to these prices!  As for the atmosphere - very loud, lots of sports games on TV and it seemed like there was a dj playing. The upstairs has a rooftop deck that I'm excited to visit in warmer months!

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame chicken

thUh0j1WGCaQPHuWGp9bLA.text: This is a bar you'll want to visit to watch a game. There are plenty of tv's.   But, we all thought visit for the first half and get an appetizer. The nachos were a small plate for the price but were very good.   Other meals are pricy and others were saying the meals weren't that great.  Lots of whiskey ... of course. Pretty extensive selection.  It was too cold to go to the rooftop area. But, we'll be back to check that aspect out and try some other appetizers.

oMa9APUFrmhXrvUfNfLKqQ.text: TRASH... they should change the nme because they don't even have a whiskey tasting menu. Their food menu is bigger than their drink menu and their drink menu has all fruity drinks.  So basically its not a whiskey warehouse...

ItxZLrs_LZ_4n7hhr6UbMA.text: Love coming here. Their food is great especially their buffalo chicken salad and their wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fingers tossed in buffalo sauce with Mac and cheese

HPuHtp1wgTw9FFpX8MWSAg.text: I've been here a number of times since Whiskey opened and it has always been a hit or miss either with food, service or both.  Today was 5 stars on the service, and food.  I highly recommend the steak wrap.  It's delicious and comes with plenty of steak.

SqJrmjiGA6hVQAs0EbUKVA.text: Went here to grab a few brews with a colleague. The rooftop area is a nice area with a view. They had a band playing that was mediocre at best. My complaint is the beer cups. They serve the beer in plastic cups that look like water cups at a fast food restaurant. Beer in plastic cups reminds me of a house party and beer in glass keeps the beer colder longer. The bartenders were impersonal and were talking among themselves rather than interacting with customers. I didn't see one of them smile. I asked for another beer and I think she forgot because I had to tell her again. We had two beers and decided not to order food.

NGgWDKhdReIXZfj0bXo6lQ.text: Wish I could give another 1/2 a star.  Stopped in for dinner with my nieces after visiting a relative in hospital. Nothing specific to complain about but nothing really to go out of my way for again.  Staff was attentive and very nice but the place was pretty empty around 6pm on a Tuesday night.

dxwfYfVAATfz9ezZytVe6w.text: Came here because of the other great reviews. It's a warm (dark wood), clean, sports-oriented venue with better than average comfort food. For me, the clincher was the great service I received from my bartender.   It was Saturday afternoon, and I needed water and some food in my belly to help fight off a hangover. After sitting at the bar and feeling that I was ignored (may have just been a minute), I said to the person next to me that I needed water and some service. Then Rebecca the bartender popped up like a magical fairy. With a smile, that never stopped, she managed to calm me down from a code red and serve up some good brunch and brew. She really tried to make sure I was ok and professionally paid attention to the detail, like sprinkling salt on my napkin so it wouldn't stick to the bottom of my beer in a frosted glass. I left very happy.  Thanks Rebecca and WW!

v3s-ipzV-kG-k7or9kdA9Q.text: Came here tonight to meet some friends to watch the patriots play the eagles(Superbowl)... i have actually been here before during the summer, they have this cool rooftop tiki bar environment at the top of climbing the  stairs here.I didn't get much here just a appetizer and a drink. Ordered the fried pimento cheese balls they were good but just a little overkill with the amount of cheese geesh. My drink was everything under the sun the cucumber mango mule,this drink was so refreshing and the alcohol level was just right in it not too much and not too little and i had two. Want to start coming here more in the warm weather when i can sit out on the rooftop.

_7za4LZlp21IDdifpd4lvw.text: The wings are great and the service is good. It's a nice Weekend Brunch kinda place, nothing more or less.

85CcZFitb5Z1SxE6-FplCQ.text: Went for a going away brunch and truly enjoyed everything! Parking is very slim but you can try to park on the street. Our waitress, Whitney was awesome!

r2oTLhb9NR3xvWNRvlr2dA.text: Food was good. Make sure you check your bank statements. I paid my bill with my card, but tipped in cash. I checked my bank account and noticed that the waitress charged me an extra $4. I called and the manager stated that she added someone else's tip to my tab. Now how often does that happen? I'm sure this happens often and people usually don't look at their statements. That was a major turnoff to me. The manager did offer me a $4 gift card or put the $4 back on my card.

LDdMdsf1aLlVi0NbPVUwKA.text: 2 stars for the whiskey special it's $4 everyday but they have roaches. A lot of roaches so beware.

S41qwgxfr847IoG0XJ92dw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat brunch. Either downstairs in the bar or upstairs on a nice day, fairly priced and always good if youre not looking for anything too fancy. Also one of my favorite places for a post-work drink.

igin6qXGcT2z2t7Doq2B_g.text: A whiskey place where there was no whiskey list and the server couldn't name off more than three whiskeys behind the bar?  Vomit in the toilet at 3:30 pm. Broken soap dispenser in the bathroom. Food and drinks were very slow to come out. Pretzel bites were tasty, so two stars for them.   They need to figure out whether they want to be a pub, a frat bar, or a whiskey joint.

_5PZXsglIhBtpbtOVpyAkg.text: This place is so cute. I love Plaza Midwood. This place has rooftop seating. The waitresses are very on point and make sure you have everything you need. The drinks are amazing. I have had the raspberry vodka summer drink and it was incredible. They had a $5 special on it last Friday. The food is ok. I've had the nachos and buffalo chicken wrap. I could make both at home. They are known for their wings so I should have gotten that. My boyfriend gets this chicken sandwich everytime he goes. I will be back for the view and drinks.

OV5XYJWkpqFacs6Isk5XrQ.text: "Jumbo wings" what a joke. Pay $16 for 10 teeny tiny wings.  If this was a cocktail bar I can understand why they'd charge $11 for a Moscow Mule but it's not. The mugs weren't even copper.   Would go back again for a beer to watch the games. Lots of TVs so it's a great sports bar. That's about it though.

OHL9sCdFBcijByU8EdtO7g.text: Go to spot in Plaza. Upbeat vibes downstairs. Great Uptown view on the rooftop. And the best bartenders (Anna will hook you up!). Good game watching spot.

0I0nW-RmzEgcohyGinMsqA.text: I'm sitting here trying to figure out how old the French fries are that are supposed to be the base of this "pouting"...  and I'm guessing they're pretty old.  I'll let them know when/if they ask.

6f2689PB7Le973bYVL4gtw.text: Great brunch spot! I'm a huge pimento cheese fan, and the whiskey poppers (fried balls of pimento cheese) were everything! Service was excellent, and the prices are very reasonable. We did not eat on the rooftop patio due to ridiculously hot weather, but we did check it out and it looks awesome for a summer night! I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

-ieT25IsN6jvBOAg9Tl_4Q.text: Wings are usually really good. But if you are a fan of HOT wings, the Suicide wings are more like I scratched my wrist for attention wings.

4d0OMZK5UxXGzGFwnYqYaw.text: I'm giving this place 2 *s for the rooftop patio and the great views only! I had the fish and chips and it was fried too hard and had no seasoning at all!! The chips aka French fries looked and tasted like they were a day old and just dropped back in some hot grease! I will return for the patio and views but no food for me!! Sad part is the cook told me about this place..shame on him!!

me8ybnzab5g37Oh4-Bg6zA.text: This is one of my favorite bars to frequent in the Charlotte area. The staff is always very friendly and attentive and the food has never disappointed but the rooftop patio is the highlight of this establishment. Come for the view and stay for the brews and food!

heFE5nU_0zeDwi5AQdkl9w.text: The only reason I give this place a 2 star rating is because the only time I have been here was when it first opened up. The bartenders did not know how to make drinks right and I got overcharged that evening there which prompted me to go to Thomas St. Tavern instead. The rooftop does have a new nice view of the Charlotte Skyline. I have heard great things about the food but have not tried yet. Update will come once I go back. I hope the service is a lot better too.

M18yN5NbGgesBTpu38xqWA.text: The atmosphere was the best thing about this place. The music was great and football was on the big screen. That was about all I can say positive about this restaurant. The french fries were soggy and not fully cooked, the bread on the sandwiches was stale and old and the wings were not crispy, just soggy. The manager asked if all was ok as I was paying the bill. I mentioned the fries were not fully cooked and the bread was stale. She just said she hoped it was better next time. What next time!? Never going back.

1d6gescRxziGcuHk7LMIbQ.text: I had a lot of fun here last night . I was a little disappointed that the roof was close but it was cold outside so that's reasonable . The bartenders did great they were very responsive for how packed they were . I haven't tried the food but I will definitely return !

RXawrxC8FobUuYLHMR8SwQ.text: Not impressed. Food was alright but do not go here on game day to eat and drink. Took almost two hours to get 1 salad, a burger, and waffles and chicken. When asked what was going on, we were told it is busy and they have a small kitchen. Food then came out cold, to which we were told they had been really backed up. I understand things busy but mgmt should anticipate a crowd on game days and be ready to provide service in a decent time frame, not lame excuses.

o-wXBgfpOCh7XPQHW8oLhA.text: Worst service I have experienced in a while. 20 minutes for drink refills. 20 minutes after our food was brought out WRONG before we were checked on. Keep in mind this is a SUNDAY AT 10pm. Not crowded. No comps occured, which should have since I spent almost a hour of my life waiting to be waited on. Don't spend your time or money at this joke of a establishment.

NuYpiDa7DOT5PAGpffjiOQ.text: The bartender Jess is a total bitch. After I was speaking to a patron who, according to Jess, comes in "everyday" and assumed I was harassing the patron. She threatened me with being kicked out for literally nothing. Look at her face and you will see that natural bitch look. Ugh. News flash Jess, you're not hot. Oh and you're in the service industry. No tip, no potential.

mPgANOMT-32uAMl6w0aTuQ.text: The food was great, drinks were tasty and average priced.  Will definitely be back!

FyrD87S3Brli9C-ZM1MvBQ.text: Love this place. Can relax and have a couple beers while having quality food instead of the typical pub grease burgers.

OsmQsJCGiIkobYD6eOquJA.text: If you didn't walk into a bar, you wouldn't know you were eating pub food. Amazing mac & cheese. Great wings. The 'famous' pimento cheese is awesome. If you are there for breakfast, get the biscuits and gravy. They are the best I've had in Charlotte!   The atmosphere is great and with the new deck open it is the place to be! If i lived closer, I'd be there every night.

NjQzEHhKh8hN-PIRK1Wdpw.text: The service is great, they will make sure everything is taken care of for you. The food is great, drinks are awesome and the rooftop view of the city from plaza midwood is priceless. Get there early to grab a seat, it can get crowded during busy evening hours and weekends. Definitely worth it for great vibes and drinks while taking in the view of the city.

QIooEbJH6bwR-yhhMvXx8Q.text: I got the brussel sprouts appetizer and boneless garlic parmesan wings. The flavoring for the brussel sprouts was delicious but the brussel sprouts were pretty hard still and could have been cooked longer. The boneless garlic parmesan wings were by far the best wings I have ever had. The chicken was tender and they melted Parmesan cheese on top of the wings. Usually when I order garlic Parmesan wings they come dripping in sauce and the breading is soggy. The breading was crispy and appeared to have very little sauce but they had a lot of flavor. I liked them so much I order them to go again the next day.

vuFp79QsdQA-FT_juW0w8Q.text: The rooftop bar is so much fun.  It was a great place to watch the fight and have a few drinks. People were friendly and it was a great atmosphere.  We didn't try any food.

SlWuZ0E185usaDzg3RuB_Q.text: While I can't certainly classify this place as a True Warehouse (see also, Men's Warehouse), it is a great bar/addition to an already happening scene in Plaza Midwood.   This place rules supreme in the Spring/Summer time, as their rooftop bar is one of the best in Charlotte. I believe nearby Peculiar Rabbit also has a rooftop, but it's sans bar, so I still would give my vote to Whiskey in this particular neighborhood.   $4 Jack Daniels AllDayErrDay, which is always my go-to. Food has always been superb, and is definitely one notch above normal bar fare.   If the weather is nice, head upstairs---you won't be disappointed.

7ayoXnCgiN7VS9zdxAvbRw.text: Bar tenders were sweet and she made me a delish drink!   Clean atmosphere and not too busy.

Av5yPxQcvUd_djWlst-LtA.text: Whiskey Warehouse is a great summertime rooftop bar to hang out with your friends. It's well lit, and has numerous fans running, so it's never too hot. Whiskey drinks are $4 during happy hour which is almost an unbeatable price. Additionally, their menu is full of pretty good bar eats that come out pretty quickly. I ordered buffalo shrimp and it was extremely delicious.  Iimane is the waitress you need. She was extremely friendly and helpful and made sure we were always taken care of.  Only thing I would be mindful of at Whiskey Warehouse is that we saw several roaches on the rooftop. I don't know if these roaches exist inside the restaurant or just on the rooftop but it made me extremely wary of my food. I had already eaten before I saw the first roach, but going forward I don't know if I'll order food, I will probably just stick to drinks if I go back. An establishment such as thing should have far better bug control.

o3QkMmPTwJ51fLoF0FcyTA.text: It was a random Saturday that a friend and I decided to check out whiskey warehouse. Upon walking and I love how the Decour is very wood base. It gives you such a old speak easy by. I love the bar, of course by name they have a plethora of whiskey to choose from. So you can switch up your favorite drink with a new type of whiskey and see how it works out for you.  We also ordered food along with our mimosas, but I wasn't able to get a picture. I will say the food came out slower than normal, even though the bar had a lower amount of people. I'm not sure what happened but I will keep in mind that if that is a normal occurrence to just give your waitress an ample amount of time.  I would come back, for the drinks. I feel like with the wide selection of whiskey they have you can have fun making and pairing different whiskeys with the food that they do offer. So I would recommend this to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mimosas

rH22u4DJ4UTCy7LNpcrHNg.text: This is hard to even write because I love this restaurant but last night I came in and I sat at the bar and ordered buffalo cauliflower and 6 jack Daniels wings. The major issue I had was watching these Wings I ordered sit up and get cold I just knew they couldn't be mine. Behold they were and they were served to me just like that the cauliflower was good and although whiskey Warehouse closes at 2 am we were closed out tab wise at 11 something. I didn't take my food to go because it was a big disappointment. The wings themselves tasted old I had only eaten one, that was the worst I've ever seen this business be. If this is the new route they're headed in then it's no place me or my staff will be revisiting any time soon  worst experience ever.......

Bdzfe8EbwUa7Mg30E4_ong.text: The food was outstanding! My friend and I enjoyed both of our meals. I ordered the Blackened Chicken Pasta, and my friend ordered the Southern Fried Chicken Sandwich. I even had enough pasta to take home for round 2. The second plus was the $2 mimosas on Saturdays. We bought a bottle of champagne and was even able to take the rest home. The only downfall was the speediness of the service. Other than that, they would've gotten 5 stars!

p5uiT_ralN36svu5MKC7QQ.text: Loved...loved... loved the Bloody Mary Bar!!! We where seated pretty quickly but took quite some time to get a server?? The new girl training took care of was. Pretty good for a newbie. However waited way to long for food but it was good so that helped out.  Food coma now for sure.  Will try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bloddy Mary bar... it&#39;s awesome!!!

LZlHeyriLG9gHugVbvKqtA.text: Prime Rib Thursday's, it's our evening to hit Whiskey Warehouse. Their prime rib is great, I recommend the Queen Cut as it's a good portion without going overboard on the red meat (see pic). They will run out, so get there before too late if you can (we try before 7pm), we have arrived later some weeks and they are already out. They also have a great view of the uptown skyline on the rooftop (with bar) when it's nice outside. Also check out the new Single Barrel Room located in the back (hours I believe are Wednesday to Sunday opening at 5pm), has a speakeasy kinda feel!

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rooftop bar and dining!
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queen Cut Prime Rib

6tLukD6Q80YLeqVwtIhnrA.text: Me and my ol lady went on a Monday for half price wings because who doesn't like a discount on wings. We decided to sit at the rooftop bar just to be out in the fresh air. Our sever was genuinely nice and was willing to help with anything we needed. I decided to get the spicy teriyaki wings with waffle fries and a mango cart brew and my ol lady had the buffalo wings with curly fries. Off presentation I knew this meal was going to hit the spot. The wings were nicely sized and tasted amazing ya hear me. Teriyaki was sweet with a kick at the end, not to hot but enough to make my nose run a little bit but that didn't stop me from demolishing my food. Heard the drinks are amazing as well which means I will have to return to try them out. But overall a great trip and cheap my total ended up being under a dub now you can't beat that. Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Teriyaki Jumbo Wings

c_Hddjpkh1meA8SJxJuCAA.text: Stopped in after going to Juneteenth. Definitely a good spot if you are a scotch/whiskey fan! Drink specials - ordered a Jack and Coke for $4 and wings ($8).

Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jack and Coke

gyoiLN6zz6GoZtn7oDkVtg.text: This is not my favorite place amongst all of the places around here in this area. I will come here for an occasional drink if others are going, but I would not choose this on my own.  The service is always hit or miss. You can't guarantee good service. They have a rooftop patio, which is a nice option on a day with good weather. Just basic food and drinks, nothing overly exciting.   I have never been overly impressed with the service or atmosphere, but don't mind it with a group of people occasionally.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

GVBtRwNe31-mOF6NpuQK4A.text: Today was not like anything I have experienced at a resturant. This was my going away luncheon and I chose here because I like the food. My self and a colleague ordered the warehouse burger, good choice until they burnt them and told us they were the last ones they have. The whole place was smoked out we could hardly breathe from all the smoke. My other colleagues received ice cold fries. After a complaint new fries were made immediately. I reordered the chicken and waffles and that wasn't bad. Still like the place.

1bLlnS-2DCQMY9gU3XZp6A.text: Food is top class. Drinks,  also very good.  Parking is a big pain in the ass and service is pretty slow.   Neighborhood is pretty cool.

owv2JdCgLmzttvB6UyiRzg.text: Probably the best Mac and cheese I've tasted in a while. The fried chicken sandwich is a must try. Very juciy and tender. Great flavor. Awesome drink specials. Curly fries are on point. Fried crispy. Service was quick and the bartender was amazing. She was running this entire place by herself. Get it girl! Will definitely be back to try the outside roof patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

oHnOlj3uOHe2aP0Nbs4VNg.text: In all honesty, they could have had a higher rating. The wings were good. The drink specials are good and their happy hour with half off appetizers is a good value. The chicken tender basket is a good value, but the tenders are just ok. Their pimento cheese balls are great. Another good option is their Mac and cheese. What brought them down to a 3 was their service. Our friend's order was wrong, and then they gave him the wrong drink. They forgot to get me my wings at first, so I had to remind them. After admitting that they forgot and me having to wait and remind them, we got nothing but a sorry. This on top of the service overall just was not good.  I have been here before because it is a good value and a cool place however, I don't come often because the service and quality can be inconsistent. At their best, they are a good choice. At their worst, they can be a disappointment. Unfortunately, the only thing consistent about this place is the inconsistency.

0r93nDA0NLAAlUhC6juYdQ.text: 7/13/18 I got the house salad and bourbon butter salmon. The seasoned veggies were tasty (just like last time) and the salmon was really good. I told the waitress that i wanted my salmon 'well done.' Typically, well done salmon while dining is not the best, but I was not disappointed. The only disappointment I had was when I finished my salmon LOL! I went again during the evening to enjoy the views and vibe of the rooftop.

OerNZEGew6btVXau3kI41Q.text: Ordered through postmates good and yummy.  Had the warehouse burger well cooked, tasty, and the Jack Daniels meatballs which were quite tasty and good.  Overall a very good meal that translated even through delivery.

aIwTiCOyRuD_kN5TI7D5Kw.text: Ummmm I was excited to finally get here. But the chairs slide downwards. I had to put my feet on another one to stay in sliding smh.  They are not made for big butts or hips even the waitress said the chairs are bad.   The food was average and drinks pretty good.  I wouldn't return unless they get new chairs . Not sure if exterminators work well for roof Tops but if so they should consider those huge water bugs or roaches ran us out of there

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Me on the roof top with the city skyline behind us.

TOw0ovHAgBq4UUyUVDhuoQ.text: It's always a good time here. I honestly don't know a more reasonable spot in the Plaza Midwood area. 4 Jacks, a decent menu, good drinks and beer on draft, and TVs playing all the games. It's also a great group spot.   In the summer they typically hair their rooftop bar open, with amazing views of the city. Some of my favorite items on this menu is the Buffalo chicken salad, buffalo chicken wrap, their burgers are really good, (vegan and regular) chicken sandwiches are good too. Did I mention the brunch?! The brunch here is amazing, along with great mimosa deals on Saturday and Sunday too! You can also do 12 dollar bottles of champagne.

OCkyjFqdnqaV-Jqli3obxw.text: Great brunch and lunch spot:) causal atmosphere. good food. decent drinks. nice servers. no complaints! Recommend the steak wrap:) so good!

0Dr86YWckgxhqJ0V-1yS6w.text: Great bar, we got wings, Monterey chicken sandwich and Brussels sprouts. Met expectations for bar food, wings were done well and Brussels sprouts were great. Attentive bar tender kept our glasses full. Only disappointment was the Whiskey collection - seems off to call yourself a whiskey bar and only have top ~10 common bourbons on the shelf (eg Basil Haden, Jack, Makers, etc) The most "exotic" available was Jefferson's Ocean and got a generous pour. They had Angels Envy and Blantons on the menu, but they said they were sold out and having difficult time with ABC getting more.

iRgcuKd_z22FqOcVoy4YMQ.text: I end up at Whiskey pretty often with clients and friends. It's a nice in between priced spot that has more than decent bar-ish type food.   Their pimento cheese appetizer is one of my favorite pimento cheeses in town. The chips it comes with are cheap though; but the cheese is so good it basically doesn't matter. They also have a chicken sandwich with the pimento cheese on it and that also rules.   Their wings are some of the best in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Specifically their dry rub recipe. They don't always have them though. Once they're out sometimes it's a couple of days before they have another batch.   The upstairs patio has a great view of the city and on a nice day the bar area up there is spectacular. They've started food service up there now which is great. The wait staff is typically hit or miss. I've had good and terrible. Kind of depends. At peek hours they're always on. I've tried a few times to watch a game or two there but it just gets SO loud. Not my favorite place if it's prime time and you're trying to have a nice quiet meal.

G01Hz-5H5fuxWeLHamWkZg.text: Plaza is not a huge area but if it is summer and your in the area, WW rooftop is the way to go! I have yet to try their food, so TBC...

_tfcu_ri4bDvTzIsrzCsYQ.text: I had to come here to update my review after visiting Whisky Warehouse multiple times this year for brunch and other weekend day drinking activities. My visits as of late have been awesome! The food was always good to me, it was the service that needed improving to make this place awesome and it did! I always sit at the bar when visiting and the bartenders are always attentive and sweet. Inside and at the outside patio upstairs it's been great. This is now added to my rotation of favorite brunches. Plus that amazing view...

Q-78M1O2fwA9ZiUgEfw-Tw.text: So- I have a theory. A group of guys at WW need to go to Soul and a group of girls from Soul need to check out WW. Basically, this is a sausage fest and the men look a little confused about why there are SO MANY GUYS there. Trust me guys, Soul is where the girls are.  This isn't really my scene, but the upstairs bar is a really great view of Charlotte. The drinks are good. The menu has some favorites (prime rib slider thing, wings, so on).   LADIES- this is a brilliant place to go if you have a couple of girlfriends and you want some free drinks. Trust me.

z2pHCUOMdrkMyMrr8PyO2Q.text: Chealsea was our server. She was amazing and funny too. Always made sure we were good to go as well as attending to everyone else. It was crazy busy but she never showed anything but a smile.

1ttzY-4TsvI_iemijMZeaQ.text: Went here to celebrate a birthday with a group of 5.  The service and the food was great.  Would highly recommend.

se2egvW_OFgya_HtxqjZiQ.text: The view and atmosphere in the rooftop bar area is great.   The food and drink are average(not bad), but I cannot speak for the whiskey, bc I don't like it in general.

rAvNo1Weeao_hPdvnjfbrQ.text: I tried going for brunch on a Sunday with my parents. My dad had the shrimp and grits and said it was so good that he went to talk to the cook! My mother and I had omelets and they were good, just not impressive. I will say that the biscuits were great. Who knew?! A friendly staff and great atmosphere didn't hurt either. I will go back to see what it's like for drinks and "bar food".   They do have the bar smell going on though but you get used to it quickly.

vKaZtRPvdRARwwCyueYKcA.text: Love this place! Came here to watch the Elite 8 games and spent most of my Sunday afternoon here. Service was great and I was happy all of the TVs had my Tarheels on!!

IP0UUZMwGf43jaJV85-I_g.text: My boyfriend and I came here the other week and sat at the bar downstairs. Usually we sit at the bar upstairs on the roof because it has such a great view, but it was a little too warm for that so we figured we would give the inside bar a try. It was around 4 in the afternoon and it was just us and two other guys sitting at the bar.  The bartender quickly greeted us and took our drink order. My boyfriends drink took maybe a minute, and she dropped it off and walked away. My drink however, showed up almost fifteen minutes later, after she stood at the other end of the bar and had a conversation with a co worker. I let it go, because for all I knew it was an important drink related conversation.  A bit later when our drinks were looking pretty low she returned, but only long enough to ask my boyfriend if he would like another and then walk away while I was mid sentence trying to let her know that I'd like another drink as well.  She promptly brought his drink and walked away again, ignoring me as I again, tried to ask her for another drink for myself.  After ten more minutes of her ignoring me as she kept walking past, the gentleman at the bar beside me finally flagged her down and informed her that I'd been trying to get her attention for a while. With a look a look of total irritation, she turned to me and asked what I needed. Finally I was able to order my second drink...however it took over another ten minutes for her to bring it to me. If I had ordered something difficult then I could understand the delay, but it was just a vodka tonic. Normally this would be the  point where we would leave and just go somewhere where the bartenders weren't so horribly rude, but we were famished and decided to just go ahead and order our food, and hope for the best...wish we hadn't.  While we were ordering, we actually caught her rolling her eyes at us.  Then when the food came out, she threw the plates down in front of us so hard, that part of my food fell off and landed on the bar, and then she just walked away without a word. That was all we could take. So after another few minutes of trying to flag her down, she finally came back so we could ask her for boxes, our check, and a manager.  She returned a few minutes later with one box (instead of the two that we had asked for), our check, and to let us know that the manager was busy and couldn't talk at the moment...Seriously?!?! We paid and left, and will never be back.

g4t1uiJS8KgMnFuZWXvAoA.text: The website says Sunday brunch ends at 2:30, but when we sat down at 1:25 we were told brunch was over and they had switched to the lunch menu. Not sure if this was a one time thing or the new norm, but highly inconvenient either way since we came here specifically for brunch food. The food we ended up ordering was great, but the service was nothing special. $12 carafes of mimosas have a surprisingly good champagne-OJ ratio (despite taking 20 minutes to get one after sitting down at our table). I'll come back here, but I def won't rant and rave about it.

EHKy0XYXr7THikC2yGrZNQ.text: After a few visits here I've really come to appreciate what they offer & that they offer it with pretty consistent service & food. I rank the atmosphere pretty high...the inside (downstairs) has a beautiful big bar, various seating options, good music playing, & plenty of tv's. The outside (upstairs) has lots of covered seating, a full bar, plenty of tv's, & a nice view of the city skyline. The food has been surprisingly tasty to me & they do it consistently. It's becoming a regular spot, especially when we learned which nights have the drink or food special we like. Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pimento cheese!!

06mlVG7h-PHhr8MvgUtkFA.text: The best chicken nachos ever! Everything was so fresh! Comes with sour cream & salsa!!! Great customer service too!

3SQAZFohf2obFdPe74wtcg.text: Whiskey Warehouse has always been a favorite when in P Wood. Food is tasty (way more than your normal bar food) and service is always friendly. The addition of the rooftop bar is genius and a perfect vantage point to watch the city skyline. Had the portabella burger last time with sweet potato fries and it was all delicious. Of course, I'm a sucker for portabella burgers, those shrooms make everything delicious.   They have a wide selection of whiskey (of course) and other liquors. And a decent selection of beer. Bartender made me a gimlet one time and it was spot on. I love me my gimlets.   They have a great space for hanging out with a group of buddies, watching whatever sport is on, a fun night out, or even a date spot (mood lighting ftw).

Yzf5mmBe1Xhx2G_Bwwh1zQ.text: Everything appeared wonderful until I bit into a piece of cardboard, and my night began to spiral down hill :(

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Found Cardboard in my meal...  And they offered nothing. Outrageously gross, to bite into cardboard !

RkQeLn_JfmwWGa6HjtJKyA.text: Won't be going back to whiskey warehouse...  Where do I begin? This is the second negative experience I have had and what is worse than that is the managers response on both occasions.  The first experience was me asking for more butter with my meal. When I received my bill there was a charge for extra butter.  When asking the manager why I was charged he said he was new and it was "company policy". Really, to charge for butter?? Should I ask before asking for more ice, salt/pepper???  The second time I was there ordering dinner again and decided on an entree. When ordering I ask if I could do a different side (something other than what the entree came with) she said sure what would you like? So I sub'd the rice and kale seed mix for a house salad and Mac n cheese.  The salad arrived first and was not cold - more room temp which is not the way I prefer a salad but waited on the entree to arrive hoping it would be better.  The food was "ok" bar food and nothing to give a raving review on. Just "ok".  I get the bill and was shocked again to see (sub house salad $3 - sub Mac n cheese $2.  I ask the bar staff and was told "yeah it's on the menu, do you want a manager?" Yes that would be great!  He shows up with an attitude from the beginning saying "it's company policy" and "it's on the menu". I ask - Why wouldn't a server mention this? "It's on the menu".   I said this is the second bad experience have had here with feeling like 1) if there is an up charge please do me the courtesy of telling me AND most importantly I have NEVER been treated this way by two different restaurant managers from the same location in such a negative way.   No - "I'm sorry. Let me take care of this for you this time but please be aware of the up-charges going forward." Nothing!!   I guess it's "company policy" to not be nice and courteous to the customer here. I will not be returning ever bc of the managers attitude and the "company policies" that Whiskey Warehouse has. Good luck!

JJiVoWt9ZQcM9Rk4CgQ7Zg.text: My friends and I come here after going to Common Market on Wednesday for the beer tastings. We've usually sat on the rooftop bar, taking advantage of the nice weather at night. Not so sure how that will work out for us next time though!  The rooftop bar has a great atmosphere. I've been up here on a Saturday night as well when it was pretty crowded, and I still thought it was great. My group has never had a problem finding a table to sit at, and it's usually 6 of us or so. Then again, we arrive a little later, around 9:30ish. The bathrooms at the rooftop are also nice and clean, though they are just one stall only.  The drinks are good, but I usually get the same thing every time and I've discovered each bartender makes them different. Some are better than others. Also, depending on who's in the kitchen, the food will be better than other nights. I had the Whiskey Glazed Salmon salad and it was very good. I definitely recommend it!

EZ6LEA9URVLocGqR6L95Jg.text: Warning: A Sunday funday could end up with you showing your ass to strangers. Not saying, just saying.   I go here a bunch, no doubt. It is, in my mind, one of THE Charlotte Sunday spots. Beyond the Sundays, a nice view, good beer prices and food that is hit and miss for me. I definitely like it as a bar, just luke warm on the food.

-RLfaZoeiVUA6zFrHRxDVA.text: I'm definitely a fan of Whiskey Warehouse upstairs. This trip I ordered the salmon to go. I asked that they substitute spinach for the rice which they gladly did. When I got home, the salmon was cooked perfectly and the vegetables were very nice.  I always get really good service upstairs.

8uOWrHOT_TY4nTzomXhcKw.text: We stumbled upon this place thinking it looked like a nice place to spend our one warm evening of the month. It sucked. Waited 45+ mins for a drink and for some soggy fries and a terrible cold "chicken buffalo wrap" it was probably the worst food I've had since moving to Charlotte. The one saving grace was that the bartenders were cool and comped our food caused they realized how much it sucked.

lzbQwiopO-EvJ8n1wbF8NA.text: So....checked out the place on Saturday night. I've only been here one other time and it was for lunch, so I don't remember too much about the place. From reading other reviews, i'm assuming the upstairs is a recent addition? I'm sure it will be a 100% return investment for WW. Parking was pretty difficult to find, but i'm sure it was probably even worse than normal this weekend b/c of the locals that were trying to flee to other places away from uptown, due to the CIAA tournament in town for the weekend. I'm a sucker for places with no cover, so that earned WW some points. We got there around 11pm and the downstairs area wasn't really that crowded. We walked upstairs and it was pretty packed....kinda hard to walk around, but hey, that's life, right? The ladies there were pretty good looking and appeared to be well put together. I'm a people watcher, so I look at everyone....as for the fellas, like others have touched on, there were your typical frats and older gentlemen that look like they just came out of retirement, but haven't been out in so long, they don't know how to fit into a social environment....Sperrys boat shoes, button down shirts tucked into jeans (oh my goodness, a fashion pet peeve for me....almost worse than flip flops with jeans and a hoodie), sportcoats that look like they came from the two piece suit that they probably wear during the week for work.....anyways, gotta stay on topic right?  Music was your typical 80s/90s hits that most bars play.....nothing special. Drinks were reasonably priced, spectacular views of the Uptown Charlotte skyline and that purrty Duke Energy Building. Would definitely check out the place again as I do like to switch up my spots....it has potential to be a good Spring/Summer joint

lABHoIDQiJhvMaicNtW9Dg.text: Joined a couple of friends on the rooftop for cocktails & apps this past weekend for my first visit.  It's my new favorite haunt.  Wish it were larger to accommodate all the adoring patrons, which by the way were fairly diverse in age which was nice.  (Although there were no children which I thought was appropriate considering it's mainly a bar.)   Although we only ordered basic bar food and a salad, all was good.  Drinks were not ridiculously overpriced which in Charlotte is a rarity.  The atmosphere is cool & cozy, the sunset view is beautiful, the service was good (bar service was stellar, table service less so but fine), and the strategically placed fans were much appreciated.  Oh, and the 80s music rocked.  Thoughtful owners.  I'll be back, again and again.  Hopefully it will remain a great experience.

R7TmQWLlpidPRcdbZTDukw.text: I love whiskey warehouse it's a nice change of pace for plaza Midwood. I generally really like the crowd that comes... The food is great, the waitresses are super friendly and the drink prices are awesome. The only reason for the four stars is the parking is really terrible!

_gEgqztc1nPiYYyoPAltPA.text: This is me giving Al and his staff my redemption song. I finally made it back in there, this time with my coupon, and had dinner again. I could make a comment on the service being a tiny bit slow.....but they were SLAMMED when we walked in. However, the hostess greeted us promptly and let us know she was doing her best to get us a table. We only waited a few minutes and they had us down and the server came by. I wish I remembered her name because not only was she personable, she was funny too....major plus. We ordered an Asian Style Grilled Chicken and Rice appetizer (which must be new,because the waitress was not aware of it) and it was awesome. It definitely shouldn't be overlooked when ordering. I got the Veggie Burger and my friend got a Maple Pineapple Chicken Sandwich concoction which I advised her against because it seemed like an odd combination. Stupid me....it was awesome! Both were actually really good. Beer was really cold and they had $2 Domestics....another plus. Service was prompt, especially considering they had 3 HUGE parties in at the same time. I will most def be back again and again. Oh.....and did I mention the manager also comped us free shots....that's service....with a smile!

3jGfQLgrh4ZWri2E8c7ZCA.text: i can not give a full review on whiskey but from what i had, the good looking waitresses and the atmosphere it makes me want to go back.i did not try any food on my visit. i did like the atmosphere and music being played and its a great place if you like bourbon and whiskey which i do.

qyzGTVTVvzTuJote9RY06Q.text: Wonderful burgers!! Friends got the wings and really enjoyed them as well. They also have great fries. Every time I've been, service has been good. Nice low key place with good food.

AYpjkhW4WQU60LdIvqW5OQ.text: Been there a few times. Great bar, and the food is really good - especially the mac-n-cheese!

1TgfAPZr9FvJJYmly7_aWA.text: Let's just suppose you are not a fan of having a wide selection of Whiskey, Bourbon, and Scotch at your fingertips that is reasonably priced. Or even if you could care less about an intriguing beer menu of both local an national brands. Maybe you don't even drink alcohol! You should still go to Whiskey Warehouse. The Plaza Midwood location is a neighborhood I love because of the community and the other restaurants and bars in the area, but Whiskey is a little different. Hardwood floors, walls, tables, everything gives it a bare stripped down feeling, but if the wood looks less than comfortable that pop a squat on one of the lush overstuffed leather couches in the corner. The food is fan-freaking-tastic! Wings, ribs, steak, and even great salads and sides for my vegetarian friends. It's never really that crowded, which is perfect because it isn't really that big but somehow gives off a spacious vibe. Maybe it's the high ceilings or giant plasma tv's over the bar. Whiskey is a great place to start or end your night. They have fun events and month long drink specials! "Home of the $4 Jack Daniels," is a great slogan they proudly boast, but I just love it for ambiance, selection, and general merriment.

nKG6iNEa8YVie_JYQOSU0g.text: Came to have a late lunch during the Panthers game and was disappointed by the poor service.  I know to expect slow service here based on my prior experiences, but today was worse than ever.  First off we were sat and our server didn't come over for over 5 minutes.  We ordered an appetizer of wings with our drinks.  When the server came back with our drinks we ordered our meal.  A while later, we still don't have wings and I see out food just sitting in the window and other servers/the manager just looking at it waiting for our server to come over- ever heard of teamwork? Then our wings come out about 5 min later by the manager who asked if they were supposed to be an app.  When we said yes, he said "oh" with no apology or anything.  Also, most of the time we were here he was standing in the corner talking to the group of servers or texting.  Didn't really seem him working.  The food here is good, but don't expect good service.

P2-903uFraumqI8hU1axhQ.text: Whiskey Warehouse has a gorgeous interior, a great concept, but terrible food and service, and management that just doesn't seem to care. I went in with a group of friends for lunch at 11am on a Saturday- we were the only customers in the place. It took over an hour for us to receive our food. At least 12 people who came in after us (and two who even came in after we ordered) received their food before we did. Despite numerous inquiries, we didn't even get an apology out of the server or management. I'd eaten there once before and the shrimp kabob had been pretty decent, but the turkey burger several of us got was dry and tasteless, and they served me a side of chopped onions and peppers as the "vegetable of the day". Onions and peppers are what you cook vegetables in! Others in our party received their food cold, ironic after how long we waited. There are just too many good restaurants in the area for me to EVER go back there again. Sticking with Thomas St Tavern from now on!

UIcGzAxqjMTtP3_fEgaG9g.text: On a Saturday night they are out of Mello yellow , ok got a Dr Pepper, then ordered blackened pasta and now they are out of noodles??   Who does your inventory here ??? Offered no compensation or fixes for the issues  Will never come again , no customer service  Waitress was less then nice

bl1EDdwvN4mA-iBy8KmE_A.text: On Monday of the holiday weekend, we visited Whiskey Warehouse in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte. This rustic looking pub has an industrial feel built into a sports bar with many TV's and a large rooftop patio.   We started with the Brussel sprouts appetizer, cooked in a white wine, garlic and parmesan reduction topped with bacon jelly. We are really not sprouts fans, but we gave them a try and were not disappointed. They were roasted, smoky and the bacon jelly could easily get addictive. Dora here. Still not a sprouts fan, but this appetizer is a great way to entice kids, er...adults to eat their veggies. That bacon's like candy!  Since May was National Burger Month, we ordered burgers. I selected the Elvis Burger, topped with peanut butter, bacon and cheese. Now I am a peanut butter lover but have never thought about adding it to a burger but will in the future. This burger was large, juicy, and tasted great. You could taste the peanut butter, but it was not overwhelming and blended together perfectly.  Dora here. Based on our friendly server's recommendation, I ordered the Bistro Burger, topped with caramelized onions, Brie cheese, bacon and a horseradish dijon aioli. Oh my stars! This juicy burger wowed me with robust flavor, the sweetness from the Brie and onions calling out for more bites until all I had left was an empty plate. The hand-cut fries were a perfect accompaniment, and finally, a restaurant that passed my iced tea test with an A+! Adding Whiskey Warehouse to our "must return" list.  I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Elvis Burger
