EuwHWy2HxsrzXUJ-nObWQQ.text: My  husband and I decided to come here last Sunday, since we heard the upstairs roof patio was awesome.......it definitely did not let down!!!  What an incredible view of the city! There are tv's all around the bar so you can watch a game and just enjoy the weather.   I ordered the mimosa ($2 on Sunday or $4 for a doube.....of course you have to get the double) and my husband ordered an OMB beer. They didnt have a ton of draft selections up there, but I am assuming their selection downstairs was larger. Nice champagne to OJ (aka 2/3 champagne) pour! I also ordered the chorizo sandwich with sweet potato fries. It had a fried egg and jack cheese on top. Very good!  It was fairly busy but we were able to find two seats at the bar. Will absolutely return!

Q0vHKbk1dIIt_JF6Q37msA.text: Above average whiskey selection!  I was impressed how this place has "Jack Daniels" stamped on nearly everything. The place is a giant billboard for Tennessee whiskey.  When we arrived, it was super loud. They had a DJ playing dance hits, with people getting out of their seats and getting rowdy with the music. The place had a definite fratty vibe.  The whiskey selection was decent. I've seen much better lists of bourbons, and it seemed like they were mainly just picking out as many whiskeys as they could. They were missing great bourbons, but I guess it's not a bourbon warehouse, huh?  They offer a variety of decent locally brewed beers, which was exciting. The beers were nearly all $5.  The service was pretty good, our drinks never went empty, and we were checked up on regularly.  The place is clean, and well kept. It has a classy interior, with an awesome rooftop patio!  My favorite thing about this place was the number of televisions that they had going. They're on every surface around, each tuned to a different sporting event. This seems like a great place to catch a game!

R6MyT46lPKNAv2MrdPf03A.text: It's TOO LOUD TO THINK! This place would be better if you could have a conversation without yelling.

wt_M0SWVCLXhRU67jIB-LA.text: I've received great feedback about the wings at Whiskey warehouse so I placed an order for wings for my latest event. Needless to say my guests thought the wings were ok at best. There were not crunchy, actually quite soggy and I was expecting the the Jack Daniels bbq flavor to actually taste and look like bbq. I will say the buffalo chicken dip was awesome!!! It was a hit and didn't last long. I should of ordered more dip and less wings.

NoNQczI5F9SEoZkj1dFJzg.text: Fantastic rooftop bar with a fantastic view of The Queen City. The seating on the rooftop bar is first come first seated. The servers are friendly. The atmosphere is always bussing with conversation and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sex on a Patio

HJTvUSsjQCwY22x1g3iAKw.text: The cost of wings have gone up for every restaurant, yet whiskey warehouse has decided to discontinue the special in which it got popular off of. I dont like that idea, what's next the $4 Jack will stop?? BS

YbquHBFxfj6BsUWoStQrrA.text: Came here for drinks with friends. I wasn't really into the music they were playing but I shouldn't be surprised. Their sangria were good and refreshing!

CYku61a-mr-yQZINv-OTcg.text: It is worth mentioning that I have never used yelp before, but the service at This establishment was so horrible that here I am. We had a terrible experience. The entrees were slow to arrive and all were cold. The drinks took literally years to come out. The cooks and bartenders are working hard but the food just sits there. The manager didn't even apologize for the slow service but did comp one drink and a burger after it wasn't delivered in the first place and everyone else in our party had eaten.   They were out of two appetizers to start. They did not help us out or offer towels or napkins to clean a spilled water glass. We had to get them and clean up ourselves. The waitresses disappeared and we had to search for them to get our checks after 45 minutes waiting.   The TVs are good but very loud if a game is on. We will not be back.

8xDgwqdhI-9qVUDjqOHAWA.text: I had been to whiskey warehouse to meet with friends for a drink but I am writing this review based on my most recent experience. It started out negative but actually ended very positive and I do plan on going back! I was at the front bar trying to get a drink when one of the bar tenders tended to people on either side of me and completely blew me off for almost the whole first quarter of one of the playoff games even when I tried flagging her down multiple times. I had been gone so long my friends had to come look for me because they thought I had left! I never complain about bad service to a manager but this woman had caught me on a bad day. I went and spoke to a bar tender in the back about the situation and she got the manager. I spoke to her about what had happened and she was extremely understanding and comped me a drink. Her and the bartenders at the other bar turned my negative experience to a very positive one and I greatly appreciated it! I would return because of the great service recovery and the fact that I don't want to let one person ruin my experience for an establishment!

qTm3GOccv4e75qEr5f73ww.text: Do not go here unless you like poor service, incorrect food, and enjoy waiting an hour for wings. Not only did our waitress take forever to take our order and bring our drinks but when the food came it was wrong. The service was unapologetic and the food was over cooked. Our drinks were constantly empty and dirty dishes were not cleaned up. The atmosphere was fun and I can imagine it is fun late at night but no way were we staying any longer.

2_UKD7CHC1IsVhTRT-kODA.text: Extremely slow service. After waiting for almost 45 minutes for a burger we got our order to go.

DrZU6sqYMI2M07fFjh9QWQ.text: Seriously what has happened to the quality of Whiskey Warehouse?  Sure if you like a whiskey drink it's the best place in town BUT, after an hour waiting for food, salmon is under cooked and my child's food hasn't made its way to the table... FAIL Salmon finally came 20 minutes after our salad and looked like dog food undercooked. I'd normally be fine but the manager on duty, Jake only pissed me off with his rude remarks and talking down to me as if I were incompetent... Wrong person to degrade buddy

T5RUnQSTTb7hvu6Z9QU1Zw.text: Food is a total disappointment here. You don't get the quality of food that you are paying for. This is a great place to come grab a drink. If the weather is good the top shelf rooftop bar has great views of Uptown.

OHts2oRDM7bWwL-fZsFQIQ.text: Service was poor, food came out at different times for our group, some of our party received incorrect orders. Food runner was unapologetic about mistakes. Most of the food was mediocre. Fun atmosphere, but only good for wings and drinks.

OnOgPIcUnnWACbgHGpgwnw.text: Not at all what I hoped this place would be. With a title like "whiskey warehouse" I was thinking of a place that would be small, quiet, and maybe even have a fireplace in the corner. But I should've known better. It's a typical loud sports bar that happens to have a wide selection of whiskey and scotch.   That being said I'm giving it three stars because the staff was nice and the place was well kept and clean. It's just not what I expected which is more of a personal problem than a critique.

C6UypYEQamMpP88SyZoW1w.text: Came here to meet up with some friends while working in the Charlotte area. It was a nice crowd with a good mix of people from younger to older. I went on a Saturday night and I enjoyed the rooftop bar and the music that they were playing. Overall it's a Great spot to go to in that part of Charlotte

gRb4cp03OMm67nWSuQIL8w.text: The food here never disappoints, but sitting downstairs inside, we might as well be outside with the number of flies and gnats flying around our food...

3VUnog4aVDMw1O-MR5o-_Q.text: Amazing service by our waitress,Tiff. She was very attentive and nice. Food was great, awesome atmosphere and you can get a pitcher of jack and coke!

I2U-GKSa9PpxS06gzb9_bA.text: What can I say but every experience here has been great!   My first experience was for lunch and the chicken sandwich was amazing. Unfortunately it is no longer on the menu. My co workers big fish was amazing as well and he gets it most of the time goes.  I have also been here for brunch and oh my it was heaven! My GF and I got the hangover helper and we both enjoyed it tremendously. I would say hold off on the syrup until you tasted it as it was a little over kill. A little to much on the flavor palate.   The couple with us had a burger and omelet and loved theirs as well. We had the pimento cheese poppers and I was surprised at how great they were. I would say get them at least once.   Staff had always been friendly and have always been great service.  I go here any chance I get!

iO7eb_wJDzamLsYf7m7apw.text: Christy was very friendly! Got the cucumber mango mowscow mule for $11 and was well worth it and I'm a dive bar drinker lol

A9QHfZ6NumJVz1HZL7qMuA.text: Normally the food here is really good but for some reason it's been flaky. Ordered wings tonight that took about 40 minutes to come out. They were fully cooked but were extremely cold in some areas. Almost as if they were previously cooked and then reheated, partially. I would've said something to the waitress but I really didn't want to wait another 40 minutes. I'll probably order again but next time I'll call ahead. Would be 5 stars because I do enjoy this place but when you charge more for wings than any other place, you need to make sure they are nothing short of perfect every single time.

kcrprW4T8Qsiow3jV1BMaQ.text: OK, so first of all...I love Whiskey Warehouse. The food is good, the people are good, the TVs are great for watching the big game. I go there often to eat lunch. They've always been good to me and the fam. But I must update my original review. I've ordered takeout quite a few times. Mostly without and issue. But for the last three times there's been serious issues with my takeout order. And usually it's not until I get the food home in "good light" when I can tell somethings wrong. Tonight, after the 3rd time I have to change my review and rating. I ordered 10 wings and mac and cheese. 2 of the wings had bones showing and were overly dry (fried hard). And one wing was so dry, it was like dry cowhide. Needless to say I was disappointed. My hope is that they will get back to providing good food and good service on takeout just as they do when you're sitting in the establishment. I'll continue to visit WWH. But not sure how soon I'll be ordering takeout though.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice Tv&#39;s all over the place
Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Part of my to-go order...2 of these wings have bones showing, the other is dry/tough as cowhide.

NADtYvDiIyqzAepp1v3Cyg.text: I would likely give more stars for this place if the service and food reviews were better.   If I could give rankings on individual 'areas' of a restaurant and get a mediums number, I'm pretty sure this would fall in the middle.   The best thing about this place is the location/atmosphere. This is in a great place, just outside the uptown and super convenient to access. The vibe inside is relaxed, but fun. My favorite part is the rooftop deck complete with a large "U" shaped bar in the middle surrounded by various sized tables. There's roof access from inside and outside the building. There's a pretty sweet view and it's just a great spot to take advantage of lovely CLT weather   My visits were complete of four women on both occasions and service was mediocre. They weren't very busy, and we often found the servers standing around the register area...sometimes eating, sometimes touching their hair. Most seemed quite young.   The beer was priced accordingly as well as the meals. They're were everlasting different dishes ordered and none of them were raved over. The True highlight for me was their sweet potatoes fries - OMG!!! I'm not a huge junk food person, but when I have good food out in front of me...all bets are off. These things are magical. I would say they're in between a shoe string and regular sized straight cut fry, made of delicious sweet potatoes. They were perfectly cooked and I don't think even one of the big ones were soggy. I personally think soggy fries (sweet or regular potato) are THE WORST! These babies are on point.. I ate all of them, but left the chicken tenders as leftovers

LWyopOlqzmYIwZkbOkMs3A.text: After two lunch visits I am still not blown away with Whiskey Warehouse. Yes, they have a great roof top patio, however, the service is hit or miss and the food is okay. I have had different items each visit, chicken sandwich and today a burger.  The burger is served with lettuce and tomato and choice of cheese. I ordered swiss and asked for red onions. Came with the wrong cheese and no onions. After reminding my server she said she would grab them and never returned.  I also sat with an empty water until the bill arrived. My friend got the salmon salad today, which came with no dressing. Once the dressing arrived he said it was okay. The place was packed, yes, it was lunch time, but overall nothing I would run back to.  Stick to enjoying a cocktail on the patio and maybe grabbing some wings or appetizers.

lGP6sYa1kNMlYqTaShEScw.text: Cool vibe, especially on their rooftop. Food was a little disappointing with no flavor. Monday's happy hour wing special is a good deal!

RVRgzx-x7eMolzeWHmERcA.text: The Good: half priced wings on Monday. $4 jack everyday and the rooftop.   Ok. I once really liked this place, mostly for the rooftop deck and tv screens. Then the last 4-5 times have been atrocious. I kept going back hoping it was an anomaly, but at this point my friends and I just find it laughable when we come home after a bad experience there.   Service is so hit or miss; unfortunately, the waitresses are handcuffed by what is clearly a kitchen in disarray. The food always takes forever, rarely comes out right and almost always cold or undercooked.   I'm glad to be moving out of the area and give my business to someone else.

xGdAdEzDO5QKEGGpQMgHnw.text: The only reason I am giving two stars is because they have my favorite beer. I am usually a patron on the rooftop for drinks. I have been here once before for dinner and the food was decent; just bar food. This time however, took us longer than usual to get greeted and or served but not because they were busy, but because they were standing around talking. I spent 15 years in the industry so didn't want to assume that this would design the pace of the rest of our service, but it did. The food was meh, objectively meaning it was not prepared as requested and there was a hair in our food (which I am not sure the server even cared when told-- was more like "oh" and took the plates and walked away). Great for a late night roof top drink party, not so much for food....especially when we have so many other options in Plaza!

Ak-v7gyoU9yeujC-4-1HZg.text: Wasn't impressed.  This is our 2nd time coming here to have a drink and eat dinner.  Our first experience wasn't terrible but wasn't the best either.  This time around we both ordered veggie wraps.  The menu stated it was a wrap with seasonal veggies, rice, lettuce, tomato and cheese.  Ours only had rice, zucchini and 1 tiny piece of carrot.  Some veggie wrap! The draft beer I ordered was out and our waitress had zero clue about any of the beers.  Our waitress, along with the others we saw, acted like they didn't want to be there as well.    They have a rooftop bar here, which is pretty cool but it gets packed at peak times.  I guess if we were to come back, it would be just for a drink on the patio.  Maybe we will give the food another shot...or maybe not.

photos.caption: Photo of Whiskey Warehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Veggie&#34; wrap (only zucchini and rice)  the menu advertises otherwise.

obp8qNO0aCAjtyf9m7Wv1w.text: The only place I will watch BAMA Football on a Saturday afternoon/evening! I mean who can really beat $4 Jacks, come on!! I love the atmosphere here, everyone is usually really nice and speak to you like we were friends in college. I love the rooftop bar especially when its a nice day outside since it can get a little loud downstairs. The wings and burgers have always been my go to when I come in and watch the game. I have also heard the buffalo chicken dip is a must try! I still need it try it myself. I always have a good time at Whiskey Warehouse, only down side is parking can be a little hard to find in the area but besides that love this place!

eV08gb_OY8VBi8GcKk5lYA.text: This is a bar you'll want to visit to watch a game. There are plenty of huge tv's.   Had a drink at the bar while we waited for takeout. I thought the old fashioned would be amazing at a whiskey warehouse. There was still granulated sugar in the glass. Dan was told the beers on tap were $4 but was charged $5.50.  Food was okay. Fish and chips and the veg burger. I'd not order again but would try something else.  We would stop by again when back in town.

CBZWSNE87TSLvFHyzybGFw.text: Wait staff needs to learn how to do breakfast....not asking if coffee needs to be topped off, stopping by after dropping off the food and before bringing the check would be nice.  No, they were not busy and had enough staff.  You could tell because they were all in one corner socializing.

iN96sUZ7QTfticQNls7Jaw.text: They should change the name.   Came here with 3 buddies so we could sample some different bourbons.   We each decided to get a different flight of bourbon.   NONE of our choices were available!   Yet all were listed on the menu.   And with three of the secondary choices, the best bourbon in the offering wasn't  available.   If they are legitimately out of this many selections, then the manager should be fired.   Our waitress was nice and that poor management put her in a challenging situation.   Our food was ok and the atmosphere wasn't bad.   But this is NOT a Whiskey Warehouse.   Not even close.

PcNgXrMi1gK1V9Zg9QIGkA.text: I like Whiskey Warehouse. We go there to sit up top and have drinks and eat every now and then. I just wish they would take the feed back on their food more seriously. If they want to charge this much, they need to provide better quality food. They have 10 wings for $16. What? A SIDE salad is $6 and trust me it's nothing to write home about. Overall, it's bar food... some things are better than others but either way it's bar food and it's way over priced. If you're going for a cool environment and a drink, this is the place but don't expect much out of the food.

tWUyf-Zw_OIntppZGd0ASQ.text: Margaux is easily the best bartender at whiskey warehouse. She's super attentive, an awesome bartender, and was really great at picking out shots we were looking for. Except for the 4 horsemen. I hate her for that. But she's cool, and better than anyone else. Totally jealous of her tattoos too.

5QKe1NxtgGFcs5BXppx7og.text: One of the best place I've been to here in CLT! Went once in a Monday got wings and they were amazing and went another time for the same and they were just as good. But went to brunch today and it was amazing I loved it. Everything was on point mimosas were beyond great. I'll be back again soon

zd8LxdcCXa0Vs0MuIX6ghQ.text: The chairs on the roof are the most uncomfortable seating I've EVER sat in. Won't get anyone to stay long in these seats.

AXTayRpt51_KbVx-LpShGw.text: Whiskey Warehouse is a great drinking spot, especially for day drinking. They have the best rooftop patio in the city. Unfortunately, it is the best rooftop in the city so get there at opening time or be prepared to sit inside/stand around waiting to steal a seat as it is first come first served.   I came here to eat last week for the first time. I usually only go here for the drinks. There was a wait but we eventually got sat. They informed us that they were giving us the new menu but they hadn't actually started serving the new menu so we should ask our server about something if we were interested. Thought that was weird... Why not just wait to put out the new menus?  They were out of a few of the beers we wanted. Ended up getting a pretty good one I had never had before. I got a steak wedge salad medium rare and it came out the steak was cold. Not just room temp but cold. Everyone else at the table had gotten something fried so my guess is that mine sat out for awhile. I hate complaining but couldn't eat it so let me server know. They must've microwaved it and brought it right back out and it was well done. I was pretty shocked they would do that. I asked for more steak and finally got it right. Chewy steak though not worth getting.   My server was great. The food wasn't so great.

UJIDHNKGnvZ6nr7C1IIuyA.text: I came here last night and I think our family may have found a place where we could become regulars. Coming in, first thought was that it was a bar...but not like every other bar where only sports ruled the televisions. It had a family feel as most bars didn't. On top of the family feeling, service was great. Our waiter was on top of everything and we even shared a nice conversation with her.  So lets get on to the food. I ordered the Charleston Shrimp Pasta which I thought was pretty good. It was a well portioned meal, with garlic bread, cheese, and of course shrimp on top of linguini pasta. I thought it was great. It had a nice blend of taste as well as a cheesy taste which I say is always good. It wasn't too overpowering to the point where you couldn't taste any of the other flavors of the dish.  Other dishes that were ordered were of course the Fried Green Tomatoes. It seems like it's a favorite around here so we decided to order it and it was good! There were no complaints about that dish.  Overall, I felt like this place was a great restaurant for families and drinkers alike. With a loft with a great view of the city (which I recommend to go during fall when it's cooler) and drinks and food, you won't go wrong!

lMSygX2sqSrz2hS7lXzsdg.text: Went for dinner and drinks on a Friday night and sat out on the rooftop patio. Really nice out there and service was good too, even though it was relatively busy. Four of us tried to share a pitcher but it would have been better for three people. That's about all you get from a pitcher, three drinks. The Lynchburg Lemonade was pretty good, had to get something with whiskey since we were there :)  Ordered the Monterey Chicken Sandwich and it was really good! Grilled chicken with salsa, guac, and cheese on a really good bun and the fries were the real kind with the little crispy skin pieces, so good. Everyone else got burgers and all finished so seemed to be good. Boyfriend got the Elvis burger that had bacon, cheese and pb on it! He liked it even tho sounds kinda strange to me. Said he'd have a burger with pb on it again :) Anywho, we'll definitely return sometime. Prices aren't too bad, great view of Uptown from the patio and heaters up there for the cooler weather. Plus its close to other bars if you'd like to hop around Plaza Midwood for the night.

hZNb6aK2TR6O_vZi4keBTA.text: I just remembered that I needed to update my WW review. The restaurant is still good.  The service is still good.  Not a lot has changed in my thinking out front. BUT if you are in need of a talented management and staff to be able to help you with a special event, I highly recommend hitting Al and the gang up for use of their back room. We took Beards BeCAUSE to Whiskey for our inaugural "No Laughing Matter" show.  It was a night of stand-up comedy to combat domestic violence.  Yes, I come up with some odd ideas. The crew at Whiskey were extremely accomodating.  They made it easy for the crowd and servers to communicate without disturbing the comics and offered their full menu.  (I housed the steak and asked for bacon added to my mac and cheese in between shows.) We comfortably sat about 55 for the first show and 65 for the second. When the first show ran a little long, the staff was totally on point with turning over the room for the second show.  And they were on the spot with more tables and chairs when the second crowd was larger than the first. They really helped fine tune my wacky idea and turned it into a fantastic fundraiser.  We look forward to going back every year for this unique fundraiser.

DwUR-n3rBhwOq3j28baqjg.text: Don't believe the hype!!! My wife and I stopped in with a few friends for some food and drinks, and the first impressions of this place is good. But that's as good as it gets. The only goal of this establishment is to take your money and in return you receive bad service. They blatantly over serve alcohol to a lot of patrons. But it gets worse, when we were able to finally submit a food order it was taken in a very unprofessional manner. Then the entrees were brought out before our appetizer, I tried to speak to the waitress about it but her response was to roll her eyes and walk off. So I requested to speak to the manager. When the manager arrived he already was very defensive and was in a foul mood. I asked him why our food came out in the order it did and his response was " be happy you got your food!!" At that point I explained to him that is not how you treat customers and that we are leaving, his response was just walking off! So as you can see don't waste your valuable time and money.

3TXgBfk0GFKqOzfbqTsrgg.text: Really enjoy the food and the service everytime I frequent this Plaza/Midwood hangout!  Great TV coverage, good music, and lots of room if you want to go with a group.  And rumor has it, they are getting ready to open a kick ass roof top bar!  Can't wait for that!  FYI...parking can be somewhat of a challenge during busier times.

ZK_MMDXLfImQK-MWzTmHHw.text: I know, I know; "Good menu selection" or "Holy cow, amazing" may not necessarily be the first thoughts that pop into mind when you think of Whisky Warehouse. But to my wonderful surprise, there's far more stacking up in this kitchen window than just good 'ol Jim Beam.   I'm so pleased to say that its name actually doesn't do this joint a bit of justice; aside from an awesome bar scene, dining area and fabulous upstairs patio, the food is the real "worker" of this warehouse.  With everything on its expansive menu from traditional Carolina classics like pulled pork and chicken dishes smothered in sweet, honey-glazed BBQ sauce, to popular appetizers like the,Whiskey handmade Pimento cheese poppers, hand battered and fried to perfection, all the way to the Creme Brie Chicken, a unique sandwich topped with cinnamon-grilled pineapple, maple syrup, Brie and candied walnuts,(um, yum) Whisky Warehouse is a Plaza Midwood "hit."  And as if that wasnt enough of a well-rounded selection to tempt even the pickiest of eaters, they take it even one step further by offering an assortment of awesome vegetarian dishes. Who wouldn't love the Commonwealth Pasta made of whole wheat noodles, veggies and Parmesan tossed in a light, creamy sauce? Literally, whatever you're hungry for, you can find.  However, the dish that takes this cake and gets all of my thanks and praises has to be the "Elvis;" a burger even the King himself would be proud of. Served with lettuce, tomato and home cut Whisky fries, this monster patty is stacked with American cheese, bacon and PEANUT BUTTER.  Yes, you read that right; the crazy combination of the juice from the burger, mixed with the creaminess of the melted cheese and saltiness from the bacon and PB, it's a combination that can only be deemed "genius". Well done, Chef Sam.   Be sure and check this spot out the next time Happy Hour rolls around, the family is in town visiting or for another perfect sunny Charlotte day on the patio. The bartenders, servers and managers have been nothing but as friendly and attentive as they could be. What more could you possibly want in a restaurant? They're the real deal, y'all.

YKKPxWcbCZLla4ipQyZ6Aw.text: Moved to Plaza area not long ago and trying to get well acquainted with the local spots. Dined here a few times now and have thoroughly enjoyed every time. Always great drink specials and food has always been very tasty. My Personal favorite, the chicken nachos. Do yourself a favor and try them!!! Also great wings and great food specials on different days as well.  Just a great little neighborhood spot for a good bite to eat and hangout with some good friends. Also, if the weather is nice, try siting on the rooftop, the view is just great!

_Can8rngop87h0b05XUn_w.text: I stopped into this establishment for lunch this week. It took me a few minutes to get noticed but it wasn't really a big deal, being in the restaurant industry myself,I know bartenders get busy. My girlfriend and I ordered a wedge salad and wings to split. We were enjoying our food until I noticed something in my salad dressing. We thought at first that it was a ring but it actually turned out to be a metal nut that goes onto a screw. We called the bartender over and she took it and walked away.  When she came back she said "Here is  another bleu cheese"  and I told her that were that we were obviously done with our meal. She responded by saying "I'm sorry, it's funny sometimes how things just get into things!" Is it funny? Because I didn't think it was that funny that I almost ate steal. She then brought me my check. I paid for my bill in full and then asked to speak to a manager.  The bartender then said "Yea, I tried to find him and tell him but I don't know where he is.  But I did tell the chef,"  I told her that I would wait to speak to a manager when she eventually found him. After 20 minutes I left because the bartender and/or manager never came back over.  I am in the service industry and I live in Plaza Midwood. It's my neighborhood but the way that my situation was handled was ridiculous.  I absolutely will never return the Whisky Warehouse. It was disappointing.  That meal should have been comped. That manager should have been available and the bartender should clearly be retrained.

XVQOZ-DKjELwY2lNZPzTSg.text: I love this place! The staff is friendly, and the food is excellent. The French fries are addictive, but if you want to save some calories the salmon salad is one of my favorites. They now serve brunch on Sundays with a do it yourself Bloody Mary Bar. I have never had a bad meal here, and since its next to my place, I eat here a lot! They also have a great wine list, and bear selection if your not a whiskey drinker. If you are a whiskey drinker try the Jack and Coke slushy. Can't be beat on a hot NC day! Great place for sports fans to watch the game!

DM2xQsp1dMapQS9ZWZaZaQ.text: another pretty cool spot in the trendy Plaza-Midwood area, one of my favorite Charlotte neighborhoods.  Food is pretty good and usually they have some type of half decent special going.  I would hardly call myself a whiskey guru, hell to think of it the only thing I know about whiskey is jack daniels and jim beam, which I know beam is technically bourbon, but they have a lot more options then the average going bar will.  Anyways, back to the warehouse review.  The rooftop bar is a great hangout, the wife and I have spent a few weekend afternoons here on warm sunny days.  The crowd is typically a late 20's early 30's kinda crowd, usually good people just looking to have a good time.  This isn't exactly the kinda place that makes you dying to go back, however, it is a cool place to spend some time have some drinks and you typically won't regret the trip.  I have heard the brunch is pretty decent but have not had the opportunity to partake myself.

t4R6M2fOZcMHglIqiKZWZg.text: Nice rooftop deck. They don't have many beers, but some different mix drinks made up for it.

kdRjFGwt4Ln6cwaGuN1RAA.text: Oh Sunday Football!! Only to be made better by the Bloody Mary bar and cheep Mimosa's oh and $2 Bud lights!! They have a map of the floor chart that shows what TV's will be showing what game so you could pick your area out. I thought that was pretty cool considering they have TVs everywhere!! It was fun and close to home!

yUb6Rm9X8SDtIymym15KYw.text: This place became the new hot spot in Charlotte. On weeknights you will find a very chill crowd with not a lot of crazies out. You can enjoy a beer with friends, have some dinner, and go home happy and buzzed. Weekends, however, have turned into some what of a Charlotte nightlife nightmare. What was supposed to be (I am assuming) a chill atmosphere quickly turns into something you would find at Black Finn (without the dancing). If you're into that sort of stuff (which I am) then it's great, but if you're not, I think you'd be better off going to Thomas Street, which has a less crowded scene.

Ht_MKCewi_if0zitj_4XVQ.text: Cool place!  I love the ambience... huge bar, lots of tables and booths, big leather chairs, chandeliers.  It's a Gentleman's bar where ladies are welcome.  I like it.  I don't know much about Whiskey but this place makes me want to try their many different kinds.  Oh, and I loooved the music that was playing.  Next time I'll try the food and report back.

suljU4YdarSxBsV7Z3HtyQ.text: Sports fan's paradise.  Seriously, there are flat screens almost lining the perimeter of the place, and a big open bar area allowing for large crows without getting crunched together.   The major drawback, in my opinion is that it's hella loud, but if you're there for the game, we'll just call that 'energy.'   If you're looking for a place to have a conversation over dinner and are not that into sports, I'd probably grab a drink there and then head to a quieter place for dinner.

oKrLNJiOqdH1ZiSO70u4gA.text: Well I don't honestly have much to say... I've been here before and their spinach dip is okay. As a vegetarian its wonderful to see a section of the menu devoted to things I can eat but I've just never ordered any of them. They have a pretty varied beer selection, which is nice, and I got an OMB Copper (or 2) for $3/pint last night. The ambiance is nice and I would probably go back. However, last night I was faced with one of those service no-nos.... actually there were two of those as well. I sat down at the bar with my friends and waited 5 minutes before either bartender realized that I was a new member of our group of 4 and that I was signaling them so that I could order. Got a beer, all was fine and then I realized I was hungry. It took another 10-15 minutes before I could get their attention for a food menu. And once I had decided it took another 5-10 minutes to get their attention that I was ready to order dinner. Let me say that the whole time I was trying to get their attention, I would raise my hand or say "excuse me" every time they passed in front of me to signal that I would like for them to come over. It was as if they were intentionally ignoring me. So I finally put my food order in (2 sides: mashed potatoes and mac and cheese) & I finished my beer. I wanted another one so I waited (again) and tried to grab their attention (again) as they were walking around right in front of me (again). I waited about 30 minutes for my 2 sides and at this point I hadn't eaten anything besides a handful of cheez-its all day so I'm getting antsy. 40 minutes pass and I still haven't received anything and I was frustrated and hungry so I cancelled my order. I didn't care to ask why or how long it'd be because they had been ignoring me all night and I didn't want to deal with that any more. Plus my friend was leaving and I didn't want to have to scarf my food down in 10 minutes. So after 40+ minutes of waiting, I asked the bartender to cancel my order & her reaction implied that she had never even put the order in. Its fine- I ended up having macaroni and cheese and chocolate cake from Harris Teeter last night in case anyone was worried about my not eating yesterday. But anyways, on the bright side, which is why this review wasn't lower, she took care of one of my beers for the inconvenience of not having any food. It was appreciated and it seems like its hard for people to take responsibility for stuff and make it right these days- especially in the service industries. I wish more businesses would do that and I'm willing to give them another chance just for that alone. Plus, as I said before, they have a whole section of the menu for vegetarian food. Can't pass that up.

RD2ir1teAtL-iwM4fPJTCQ.text: the current reviews back up my review I did over a year ago....in a neighborhood w/as many great bars as P-Wood has, WHY would anyone bother coming here?...although as it IS a landing point for every poser-ey douchebag & pretty person in a 10 mile radius, maybe we SHOULD encourage its existence so they can all flock here and stay out of the good bars in the area...so if you're reading this and from the 28210-28211-28207 zip code, WW is the greatest bar ever invented by man or God.....

hwZkXfSCQGoShwtXrNoltg.text: I'm going to start off by saying great atmosphere and a great rooftop bar... However the service is terrible! I went in with another girlfriend of mine around 11pm on a Friday night. We sat down at the bar downstairs (which wasn't overly crowded) and ordered a couple of drinks. We let the bartender know we were checking out their late night menu but needed a minute. After a few mins of talking we decided on some food to order and shots... It took the bartender at least 35-40 mins to come back to us. After she had helped almost every guy at the bar was it she noticed us waiting. We promptly asked for our checks without ordering anything further because at this point watching people walk up to the bar and get helped while we were sitting there waiting was beyond frustrating! On our way out we decided to walk upstairs in which we ran into a group of our friends who were having a going away party. We once again decided to try an order shots but the bartenders upstairs were to busy chatting and dancing to notice there were people waiting! No one wants to stand around waiting forever for a shot! Once again it's a great place to hang out but just don't expect any good customer service!! Already saw a bad review about being a female and trying to get service here and it's 100% True!

UhxqCAfbSXRWc3i-Yht2IA.text: Let me be clear from the outset, the food is not great. The Barballo chicken wings are the best thing on the menu... That said, we love this place. Only go to the "Top Shelf" deck and generally from the outside stairs. The deck and the staff have a nice buzz..... and so do I after the 1/2 off wine on thursday. The deck is head and shoulders above ( literally and figuratively)  everything else in Midwood. service comes with genuine smiles, and they actually know what they are doing. Great deck, veiw, people watching....enjoy

aANuJfbg_fRENcQ_k1rcSg.text: We just returned from lunch at the new Whiskey Warehouse and based on the very few (as of this writing) reviews out there on the internet we didn't know what to expect. I have to say that I was pleased with the experience overall. We used to frequent the previous establishment at this location called Creation and wondered how they would change the layout and decor. Well, it's nothing at all like the former restaurant. It truly has the look and feel of a combination saloon and warehouse - hence the name (with a few high tech touches thrown in). A lot of dark woods and an open floor plan make it inviting and unpretentious. The long bar which goes nearly 3/4 of the length of the restaurant is sure to be one of the neighborhood's most popular draws.   Even with the small amount of people in there at 11:45 a.m. on a Wednesday I was surprised at the noise level. My dining partner and I had to talk loudly to be heard. I think it was partially because there was a large 50" television with the volume on less than two feet from us coupled with the exposed ceiling and general openness that doesn't absorb sound. If that place ever fills up it will be ear shattering. At the very least they should mute all of the televisions so people don't have to talk over them - with the exception of maybe during Panthers games or larger events like the Superbowl.   My dining partner and I enjoyed the food but didn't partake in any libations since it was still the middle of the workday. We plan to come back for a happy hour sometime in the near future. I had the prime rib sandwich and sweet potato fries. I would grade both at about a B. The well-seasoned beef was shaved instead of a big slab and I preferred it that way. The bun was nothing more than a large hamburger bun and I would have preferred a nice Ciabatta bun or Sour Dough hoagie instead. I also would have liked more of a kick in the horseradish mayo. It was a bit tame and I could barely taste the horseradish. The sweet potato fries were good but unspectacular. I mean, they are just fries so there's not much you can do with them, but they were worth the $1 up charge. Portions for both the sandwich and fries were large. I really felt like I got my $9 worth. My dining partner had the Whiskey Glazed Salmon Salad. She was very happy with it. She was certain the salmon would be overcooked as most restaurants do but she was happy with how it was finished. Her salad was also a very large portion and she said she would definitely order it again...in her words "a keeper."   The menu to us was just the right size. It was double-sided with about 30+ salad, sandwich and entree items plus 8 or so appetizers. There was a little something for every taste including vegetarians (but nothing vegan because of the dairy).   Again, we can't speak to the drink menu but it's clear they have just about anything you would want. There were a couple of drink specials written on the board so there is probably something for every budget too. I see this place becoming popular with the after work crowd. Since the bar is so large it seems like a nice place to belly up and hang out with coworkers and friends for a few cocktails on a Friday evening.   Service was fine. It was about what you would expect at your basic neighborhood restaurant - enough attention without feeling either swarmed over or neglected. Our water glasses were always full and the food was brought out in about 10 minutes.   I realize the place is new and has yet to develop a following but I was surprised at how empty it was at noon. It was just the two of us and a small group of firefighters from the next door station. There also appeared to be one of the owners or managers with a vendor at another table discussing business. But that was it the entire time we were there.   If this restaurant is to survive where others in this location have failed (and the owner is reading this) they need to get the word out aggressively. Word of mouth will only go so far. Consistently send around fliers to local businesses with drink specials and coupons and I predict they will fill the place very quickly. And if they keep serving good food with good service like they did today they will hit a home-run in the Plaza Midwood area.   I think 3 to 3.5 stars is appropriate. That doesn't mean it's bad, just not extraordinary. I'll call it above average. We will be coming back for sure.

fOt8oh0h_2ESfJuNNBzTIw.text: I'll be back for more of a review later but John H's comment regarding parking are spot on. The car out front needs to go. Every business in the neighborhood deals with a lack of parking and this just contributes to the problem, no matter if it's just one car. It does come across as a bit arrogant and won't sit well with the neighborhood over time.   That said, great place to go watch a game.
